Fine as it may be, it's more of a gadget.  For real computing use, I'm sticking with my Win7 netbook until these things evolve a little more.

Reviews.Title: More Tablet for Less Money (Tab 2 vs. iPad 2)
Reviews.Author: CompuForensics
Reviews.Content: I was recently asked how the Tab 2 compares to a higher priced iPad 2. I own a couple of Apple products, including their ultimate PC, the multi-quad core Apple Pro. I teach computer science part-time at the university level.The short of it is that the Samsung is more tablet for less money. I bought mine for under $300. Both have a 1Ghz dual core processor. The Samsung has double the RAM (1GB vs. 512MB), microSD storage expansion capability, and significantly higher resolution (1280x800 vs. 1024x768). The Samsung display is also larger (10.1" vs. 9.7"). Both have Bluetooth, but the Samsung runs a newer version (3 vs. 2.1).Unlike the iPad, the Samsung is Flash friendly. Installing Flash from Google Play is easiest on all but the most recently produced Tab 2s. If you have the most recent one, like I do, installing Flash for Android 4.0 from the Adobe Flash archive site was just a little bit more work.Battery life is another advantage of the Tab 2 over the iPad 2. The Tab 2 has a 7000 mAh battery rated at 14 hours. The iPad 2 is rated at 10 hours (Apple tends not to share detailed specifications).The iPad 2 and Tab 2 have comparable forward and back facing cameras. At a little over 3mp on the rear camera, neither is particularly special. The iPad 3 and Galaxy Note include a 5mp rear camera that does a better job. Still, neither the 3mp nor the 5mp camera is going to give you results comparable to even a sub $50 digial camera with a much higher resolution chip and larger optics.When you compare the Tab 2 with the comparably priced iPad Mini, the iPad does even more poorly. For a tablet that gives the Tab 2 a run for its money, you might want to take a look at the new $400 Nexus 10. The Samsung produced Nexus 10 display is the highest resolution on the market at a fraction of the price of iPad 3s and 4s.

Reviews.Title: More Fun Than a Puppy
Reviews.Author: Gary Fisher
Reviews.Content: I've owned tablets for a long time, beginning with my NCR 3125 and including my Kindle Fire, but as a personal computer my Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 is the best so far.  With a screen the size of a fine notebook -- noticeably larger than the iPad's -- and access to the full library of Android apps, the Galaxy perfectly fills that gap between smartphone toy and laptop tool.  The ability to link a Bluetooth keyboard, one of the Fire's only serious shortcomings, makes the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 serious technology for serious work.But entertainment isn't forgotten.  Coupled with my www.amazon.com/prime account I've watched dozens of movies, TV shows and other videos (most for free) and listened to hundreds of songs, again often at no charge.  With the Kindle App (included on the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1) I have full access to my complete Kindle library; though I prefer my Fire for most reading simply because it's easier to tuck in a pocket, reading on the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 is an enjoyable experience, especially for someone whose eyes, like mine, have given many years of good service.For research, data collection and similar functions the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 is simply unparalleled; the two built-in cameras are perfectly usable for record-keeping or casual photos.  The built-in GPS is stunningly accurate, and the internal position sensor lends details hard to obtain from other sources, such as position and bearing of distant (even aerial) objects and navigation info.  I have had a great deal of fun with the astronomy app, which shows a detailed sky map as though it were a window into any direction I hold it, including through the Earth; amazing!I really can't recommend this enough.  If you've been considering a Tablet, go right to the best and get a Galaxy Tab 2 10.1.  OK, maybe a puppy would be tough competition for pure fun, but the Galaxy won't leave little messes on the floor.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Maria Villafane
Reviews.Content: This tablet is without a doubt an excellent product. I've had it for about 8 months and I can't really say there's anything that bothers me. I paid full price and I believe it was worth it. So far battery life is just as good as it was when the tablet was new and I believe even when watching videos ans playing music, the battery holds up pretty well. Aside from the obvious, which would be sending email, browsing the web and streaming music and video, which this tablet does well, there are a few features that I love. First, I love being able to search my files just like I would in a computer by using folders. The integration between the Xbox and the tablet is awesome, being able to use my tv screen by having my Xbox on and controlling music, video and picture slides from the tablet is amazing and it makes everything so easy. Being able to access files from my Samsung galaxy s3 and send files directly to the phone works great as well. There's 2 Samsung tablets and 2 Samsung phones in the house and all the products work great together. Other than that I think the touchscreen and keyboard are both fast and responsive, the system crashes rarely and the tablet seems to handle all apps without any lag or any major issues. I still ask myself, what's not to love about the galaxy tab 2 10.1? I love everything. If I were to get a tablet now, I would get this tablet again. My boyfriend just got the smaller one and he loves it just as much!

Reviews.Title: As expected, no surprises, easily upgraded to Jelly Bean
Reviews.Author: Frank Oros
Reviews.Content: Although delays in the warehouse got me worried initially about the tablet making it here on Saturday as required, all went well. Fedex showed up as expected and everything was intact, nothing missing. This was a concern for me, since this was a refurbished tablet.The unit was charged to approximately 70% of capacity when it came out of the box, so achieving a full charge didn't take very long. Upon initial power-up, it acquired my wifi immediately and was net ready in less than two minutes. It ran through available software updates and all downloads/installations were logged in the status screen on the lower right corner of the tool bar....very convenient. Since I have a Samsung phone, PC and flatscreen, the Tab 2 quickly synched with everything, including my GMail and cloud files. To be sure I had Jelly Bean as my OS, I went to Settings, Device and manually obtained 4.1.1. I also selected the power-saver mode in the settings menu. Once I'd rebooted, JB was in place and running. The next few hours were spent downloading familiar software and setting up my home page. The screen is very responsive, and my daughter (a dyed-in-the-wool iPad promoter,)was a little envious of the vivid images I was showing her, as well as the versatility of the Tab 2. (It's nice when the old man is right once in awhile!) In all, I was on-line for more than 9 hours, and my Tab was showing that it still had 40% of it's battery left. It took another two hours to get down to 22%, at which point I finally plugged it in. By the next day, I was using it to control my flat-screen HD TV, and play movies from NetflixOverall experience so far is excellent. Would recommend the Tab 2 to anyone.UPDATE SINCE INITIAL REVIEW: If you use a lot of apps that employ Java, they will not be supported on this tablet. After many attempts to initiate Java-based apps, I finally gave up and contacted Samsung Tech Support. They informed me that Oracle (Java's owners) and Samsung are in litigation, and Oracle has ceased support of the Samsung OS, so Java is unobtainable. Otherwise, everything else is running great. I'm hoping that eventually Oracle & Samsung will settle their differences.

Reviews.Title: Sorry Samsung/Google--Must Ditch The Tab 2
Reviews.Author: Elder Dave "adman62"
Reviews.Content: It actually grieves me to write this review because I like the Tab 2 in a number of ways, but with the latest download of Jelly Bean 4.2.2, my tablet keeps turning itself back on after being shut down. Even more concerning, Google Wallet will not let me sign in and register a charge card; it gives the message "Your Device Is Not Supported." Not supported??? Called Samsung: they definitely asserted that it was not their problem. I got Google to call me (I couldn't find a way to call them for service). They called me, and the first specialist couldn't understand what I was saying, but he finally told me the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 was not on the accepted list to use Jelly Bean 4.2.2 and that Google Wallet was not supported  on it. He ultimately passed me over to a higher level tech who assured me there was nothing anyone could do about it. Nothing anyone can do???Jelly Bean is the operating system. If it won't let me download magazines and books because paying for them is not supported, what good is the tablet? Yes, it works great for Internet access and has a number of dandy apps. The puzzling thing is that so many others seem to be able to use the tablet happily and usefully. Just my bad luck? I don't know, but if both Samsung AND Google tell me there's no hope, what choice have I left.Happily, Amazon, being the great company they are, instantly issued me a refund and took the return. I really didn't want to do this but---there was "nothing anyone could do" to help me.Anybody recommend a less buggy tablet???

Reviews.Title: Not a 5 given drawbacks, Adobe Flash issue & Apple type plug
Reviews.Author: C. McKenzie
Reviews.Content: I already own a Kindle Fire (the old one) and was looking at either buying the new 8.9" or a 10" Android tablet.  When seeing that some refurbs of this brand were available for $295, this seemed like a better deal.  I have had it for 2 days now and wanted to create an initial review;Pros;*  the screen is very bright and very clear*  my refurb version looks like new with no imperfections that I can see*  fast response - I was having some slow response and then figured out that the power saver was set to restrict the full CPU use.  Once I turned that off, performance was much better.*  fast start up and switching between landscape and portrait quickly.*  so far, battery life is very good, but that is something you have to wait and see how it goes.*  not part of the device, but was able to get a 2 year warranty and accident protection from Square Trade for $42.  Since it covers accidents with no deductible, I thought it was worth it.  I bought this separate with a 30% coupon and not through Amazon.  If you are buying a refurb, be sure to buy the warranty on the same day you buy the device even though you don't have it in your hands yet.*  Amazon Kindle store and Music work great.*  Email program, calendar & contacts programs work great with my work email (MS Outlook exchange server).  Did not have to but a separate program like I did with my Kindle Fire.Cons;*  was not able to watch Amazon videos until I found a compatible Adobe Flash APK.  It took 2 tries, but did find a version that worked and now I can watch my Amazon videos from the browser.  If you are a big user of Amazon video, you need to know this before buying this product with Android 4.0.4.*  went through 2 upgrades after connecting to WiFi.  The upgrades went well, but probably would not need with a new tablet versus the refurb I had.*  more than 1 app that runs on my Samsung Galaxy S2 phone is not available for this device.  Strange to me, but it is what it is.  For example, the Amazon store app and Lync 2010 run on the phone, but not available for the tablet.  This makes no sense.*  noticeable differences in the way the tablet works versus my Samsung phone.  Both are running Android 4.0.4, so I was surprised with the differences in the way things work.  These differences are not great, but it took some playing around to get use to them.  I assume this is done so it is easier to use the tablet.*  BIGGEST CON - the plug for the power.  Why in the world they went with an Apple iPod type connector I don't know.  Every other device I have uses the small USB.  This is a real pain because I thought I had finally gotten past having unique plugs for each device.  I should have done more reading because I'm not sure I would have bought this knowing the plug was different.Bottom line, if you are buying my advice would be; go for the refurb, get a warranty, know about the plug difference, and remember the Amazon video issue.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Thomas
Reviews.Content: I bought this so I wouldn't have to be at the computer all the time when I am looking up simple things online, and turns out that this is the most perfect thing I could ever use. I have no problems with this product at all. It works well with all the apps I have downloaded and is just simply amazing. I recommend this to people who are looking for a pad like this but isn't looking on spending $700 on one.

Reviews.Title: Good time to buy this!
Reviews.Author: rbhatta "A Dinosaur you can trust!"
Reviews.Content: It is by far the best time to buy this Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (10.1-Inch, Wi-Fi) if you love to have flexibility to be either in Google Ecosystem or Amazon App store. This tablet gives you access to all the features one can possibly want in a tablet. My main reason choosing this over other tablets in the market was purely because of the possibility to have additional SD card slot which can accommodate microSD memory up-to 32GB. I purchased SanDisk microSDHC 32GB Flash Memory Card  to keep my precious family photos and videos my favorite music files and still had plenty of room for more for the future.PROS[+] Comes with Jelly Bean OS 4.1 (First version pre-installed)(Amazon needs to correct product description)[+] Awesome & gorgeous display (May not be high-def like retina display in iPad but good color and contrast)[+] Excellent battery life (more than 9 hrs of continuous use with power savings option)[+] Bluetooth Audio is super (I can stream to my Home Audio Receiver with excellent clarity)[+] Comes with IR Remote so you can control all your entertainment devices and supports multi-room options[+] Built-in speakers are pretty good and front facing[+] Rich web browsing experience and pretty responsive in loading websites[+] Flexibility to get apps from Google Play and Amazon App store[+] Wi-Fi range is good and holds steady connection throughout the house.CONS[-} Adobe Flash player is missing (but there are workarounds available to side-load to enable Adobe flash)[-] HDMI output requires additional optional Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 HDTV Adapter[-} Some games do not work in Jelly bean OS (Not a Samsung Tab issue but still a CON)[-] Does not support Amazon Instant video (Amazon needs to come-up with an app for Android)Even with all the CONs mentioned above this tablet is very good purchase. Love the look and feel of the tablet not too flimsy not too small not too big just perfect size for entertainment.I am rating this tablet four stars and it is the best time to buy this - Highly recommended!Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Ye Li
Reviews.Content: Excellent hardware, expendable sd card slot, IR blaster,  fast response, wonderful UI becuase of the best OS - Android, millions of usefull apps, majority of them are free, yes FREE!! This second generation tablet is better than the first generation, but the price is much lower than that!  Do not look at crappy Ipad (whatever generation) stuff. Compare to this tablet, ipad tablet are inferior products but charge outragous price!  save your some money for some useful apps, books, etc...Android (the google OS) This is the way to go.  cuz it has the fastest growing applicatons.  Look at history. the Apple will fail again. for their unwillingness to open their platform.

Reviews.Title: Beats the kindle HANDS DOWN!
Reviews.Author: Sandar
Reviews.Content: Don't wast your money on a kindle fire hd. You can't even take pics with the lousy thing.This does all the thing a kindle fire hd can't do and much more.

Reviews.Title: Streams video (Netflix is perfect), great features, idiotic location of charging port
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Drew "Anaal Nathra/Uthe vas Bethod...
Reviews.Content: Our family has a couple of iPads, an iPhone, several Droid phones and three Droid tablets, including this one.  I really like the tablet. I stream Netflix, read books, you name it. The downsides include a bone-headed location for the proprietary charge/dock/USB port. It's on the "bottom" beneath the Samsung logo. If you're using the tablet in landscape mode, you can't charge it if it's in a case - unless you pay for the dock. Then it's not very portable. The iPad has the port on the side. Makes a lot more sense.Big plus - it uses Corning "Gorilla Glass" - looks and feels like plastic, but it's not.  But, it's obvious that Samsung cut corners where they could. Cheesy plastic cap over the memory card and the frame around the screen is painted.One thing to watch out for, and I reluctantly ;-) give the iPad caveats here - when you close the case lid on an iPad, the iPad sleeps. Not with with the Tab 2. Plus, when you plug in the charger, the screen turns on.  So if you close the case and plug in the charger, the screen turns on - but you can't see it.  I did not figure this out until I charged it a couple of times overnight, only to have the charge max at 90%. I assumed the screen turned on when I removed the charger, as it was on when I opened the case. Nope.  So you either have to shut off the tab (not put to sleep) before charging, or plug in the charger, then put it to sleep.6 month update: Still like the tablet, but there is one major annoyance - Samsung's required website check-in.  The tablet checks Samsung for software updates. I don't use the software and uninstalled what I could - there are much better third party apps out there. Every few weeks Samsung resets your security information - so your password and user name have to be re-entered.  I was in the middle of taking notes when this "security" message popped up. I chose "cancel" - it came up again 15 seconds later. Cancel. Came up again. Cancel. Then every 10 seconds. It would not stop. The tablet was useless until I logged into the site.  I was not home and did not have access to the email account associated with the tablet - and since I had no idea what password I used, I needed the reset link sent to me.  So I had to put up with the message every 10 seconds.  Had this been a $75 tablet it would have been an expensive Frisbee. Idiotic that the software ignores the "cancel" and even worse that I can't postpone it for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: Awesome...
Reviews.Author: Ramp "Ramp"
Reviews.Content: I just received my Galaxy Tab .. it is awesome. I already got the Peel remote working with my TV and receiver equipment. Downloaded the apps I needed. Main reason i got this is to read my technical books, PDF looks great in Kindle app.I dont like the fact the Samsung proprietary port and no HDMI but other than that.. it is great so far. Will update more as I play around further.Update :I noticed the top left corner of the tablet is kind of squishy, I can feel the top glass moving with squeaky noise.Looks like the glass is not properly attached to the body. Not sure if everyone has this issue. I may have to get a replacement. Otherwise I am very very happy with the tablet. It is kind of very slightly choppy with flash videos and some rare processing speed issues with some apps, but does not matter to me much, I can live with that.Update2 :Amazon promptly sent me a replacement and the new one is perfect.

Reviews.Title: great buy!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Kornhauser
Reviews.Content: First of all I'd like to thank all previous reviews about this product. They were my main source for making my decision.I was between getting an Ipad 2, the kindle fire HD 8.9 and the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1. I ruled out the ipad mainly because it was so expensive. Its screen resolution is poorer than the tab 2 and it doesn't have a micro sd slot.The kindle fire is definately a competitor pricewise but I've seen the operating system and it just seems so limited to amazon content, plus no widgets. The sound quality is like no other but that's what I have a home theater for. On the go I usually plug in headphones so no gain there.As soon as I saw the tab 2 10.1 priced down a hundred bucks I knew it was the one. I must say it was an excellent purchase!! Completely met my expectations.Even though the galaxy tab 2 10.1 is a weeee bit sluggish, its barely noticeable. I imagine that for intense gamers this may bother you after a while.Pros:- great screen size- new operating system is very clean and extremely versatile (like most androids)- front speakers give off great sound- memory slot can give you up to 32gb more. A total of 48gb for an extra 20 bucks instead of other tablets that would charge you well over 100.- great battery life. Normal use connecting and disconnecting wifi, downloading, reading and typing gives about 8-10 hours.- at 300 bucks. Great price.- 50 gb of dropbox space for a year.... FREE- at least mine came with an extension cable. The usb adapter is way to short but with this i don't have any troubles.Cons:- processor is a bit slow but for everyday use, movies and small games its more than enough. Make sure you free up tasks and memory.- keyboard is difficult to type with. I'm always tapping the shortcut button thats just below the spacebar. can't get beyond typing with two fingers either. Considering getting a bluetooth keyboard.- I'd avoid using the camera except for videochatting. Leave taking quality pictures to digital cameras.-touchscreen precision could be much better. Maybe its because of my butcher hands but I tried using a stylus pen and it was a bit off and wouldn't follow through when writing. I wanted to be able to take notes with a pen but it would be extremely frustrating. I read somewhere that the touchscreen precision is set by samsung but you can tweet it using the touchscreen tune app.All in all I must say this is an excellent purchase. If you're looking for a tablet for everyday use and doing some light work with office docs I highly suggest this tablet. I also recommend you get a case with it while you're at it.If I may suggest a few apps:- google chrome. Fast web browsing plus compatible with the PC version- google currents. Get news from different sources. Cool interface- Repli Go Reader. View, edit and add objects to PDF files. I use this for work all the time. Well worth the price.- flash player. Yes, you can use flash on this. The only thing is that it doesn't work on chrome but it does work on the default explorer. Just google adobe flash archives and download the APK 4.0 version. WORKS- Appsales. Shows apps everyday that are on sale. Managed to get some high end games and office docs app for 1 dollar each.

Reviews.Title: Very good.
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the product. I use it also as a photo album, and you simply copy some random folders to the memory card you inserted directly in your notebook and it shows them in all galleries, try that with ipad ;-)The sound has a very good quality, screen is awesome.

Reviews.Title: People still buy iPads?
Reviews.Author: Scott Ontiveroz
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine why someone would do that. I've had this same Galaxy tablet for almost a year now and I got this new one for my girlfriend. We both love it. She is in nursing school, and there are tons of apps available that are useful for that application.If you don't know how to operate a tablet, get an iPad, that's for beginners.If you want the best tablet money can buy, that is fully customizable and has tons of settings and features that you can adjust to your personal specifications, get a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1.

Reviews.Title: On the whole, a neat little device
Reviews.Author: three bars
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tablet because I constantly find myself in boredom-rich situations that are unavoidable and I am tired of squinting at five-inch screens. The Samsung is a nifty product. I won't go into style factors because I don't care about that stuff. The only improvement I would make is to give it UBS functionality. Other than that, I like the quality of the display, the lack of latency in the touch screen response, and the intuitive interface. Took it out of the box and was up and running in no time. Still discovering a lot of little things that I thought might be drawbacks but turned out to be just part of the learning curve, but all in all, well worth the expense and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Freakin Awsome
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: This Tablet rocks!! First off, I would like to start off this review by saying the quite vivid display is absolutely fantastic. Its Bright as heck and the colors just seem to pop out @ you. Next the 16gb of factory memory is nice but you can expand to 32gb, which is what i did before it even arrived @ my house. I downloaded the netflix app and it works flawlessly. Its overall appearance is slim sleek and sexy, Very easy to hold and to navigate. Set-up was quite easy and fast, it only took me 1/2 an hour till i was up and running. It also has a really cool remote feature that i set-up with ease. Over all I give this tablet 5 stars because its easy to use and has a really bright display, oh i need to mention the sound. The sound is pretty big for such a small device and can handle movies, music and sports. Get this you wont regret your decision one bit!! hope you found this review helpful.:)

Reviews.Title: Why I bought a Galaxy Tab 2 10.1
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I needed a tablet to do some apps, but mostly wanted one to read email and surf the web without waiting for a PC to boot.  I liked the Ipad, but was profoundly annoyed at the $100 price premium extracted by Apple.  It was even worse if you bought one that did 4G.  I wanted something with 32 gig, so the Apple would have cost $599 for WIFI, and $729 for 4G.  Way too much money to surf the web and check email.  Finally, I hated the cult mentality of the whole Apple scene.I liked the Asus TF700, but was completely put off by the build quality issues, and the glass gluing problem discussions that were hitting the forums.  Why pay $499 for something that was poorly built?Saw a Galaxy at Sams, and was impressed with the build quality.  Rugged, nicely put together, and seemed fast enough.  Although it was only 16 gig, I could add a cheap SD card to bring it to 48 gigs.  Plus, the price was only $399.  With a bunch of discounts that I had accrued on my Amazon account, I picked it up for $250 new from Amazon.So far, so good.  The android marketplace for apps is still in its infancy, but I hope it gets better as time goes on.  Wish there was a Quicken app, but we'll cope.Hated the short USB cable, but added an extension, and that works fine.UPDATE:If I had to do it again, I'd buy an Ipad.  The Galaxy doesn't even come close.  I've used a number of customer's Ipads, and they work amazingly well.  When you touch the screen, the right link comes up. On the Galaxy, you have to click multiple times to get it to respond, or you have to enlarge the screen to be able to touch the right one.  It's slow, and if something is downloading (like email or an update), the ability to touch the screen stops until the CPU catches up.  Worse, it seems that every week or so, the software plugs up, and everything slows to molasses speed.  Fixing it requires a power cycle.My customers' Ipads work flawlessly.I'm not a big Apple fan, but the Galaxy product just doesn't measure up.  Buy the Ipad.  Even with all of the negatives, it's a much better product.

Reviews.Title: What do you expect?
Reviews.Author: RegalEntity
Reviews.Content: This product meets all the required standards for a moderately expensive tablet. There really aren't any issues that I can attribute to this tablet. It's the Samsung Galaxy II! What would you expect from such a prestigious tablet? It works well, and I believe it to be the best bang for your buck. WiFi works extremely well. Picture quality is adequate (It's not a digital camera or a camcorder). The sound quality is decent for the size. If you would like to fill the room with sound, I would recommend purchasing some bluetooth speakers to sync with the tablet, to ensure satisfying sound quality (but not a crucial application). Able to insert microSD which is essential for storage space, and it alleviates the complexity of transferring data for those of us who aren't technologically savvy. Just some insight for those who will be purchasing a tablet for the first time. Make sure you get at least a screen protector although a case for the tablet would also be prudent. Never wipe your screen without some type of lubrication, if your just using a soft cloth out of your towel collection. Spray the towel or cloth with any reasonable type of cleaner and then apply it to the tablet. These screens will scratch easily and although it normally doesn't effect the picture quality and may hardly be noticeable, trust me, you will notice it. haha Anyway, good buy and well worth it. Good luck with your decision.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: John David Valter
Reviews.Content: I had been considering purchasing a tablet for quite some time, but I'm careful not to buy on impulse. I looked at several different tablets and vacillated back and forth for several months on the different brands and models. Recently work issued me an iPad, which I like very much, but it seems too proprietary with what you can put on it, etc. Don't get me wrong; it's a great product, but just not for me. The thing that sold me on the Samsung was the expandable memory and the Google Play store. Before purchasing, I checked the Google Play store to see if it had all the apps that I use on my iPad. The only one missing was an app for watching recently broadcast PBS shows. Perhaps I missed it or maybe someone will develop one soon; in any event I can probably just watch them directly in the browser from PBS's site. The many positive reviews of the Samsung tablet here on Amazon also influenced my decision to purchase. I'm still learning new features of the tablet and how to navigate within it since it's a bit different from the navigation on an iPad. I don't regret purchasing it at all and look forward to using it for some time to come.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Tab 2 10.1
Reviews.Author: marty
Reviews.Content: I first tried an iPad 3rd gen and immmediately like Tab 2 better. It's somewhat of a personal preference, but I really don't like Apple's lock down monoply and the lack of flexibility of their products. For example, the iPad 3 costs about $500 for 16G and the Samsung was closer to $300 for 16G. You cannot add memory to the iPad. If you want 32G, it cost $100 more, 64G, $200 more. I spent $20 on a 32G micro SD card and now have 48G.The tv control function on the Samsung is awesome! Everyday I'm finding more and more things that I like. Give one a try.

Reviews.Title: galaxy tab 2 10.1 is solid tablet
Reviews.Author: Steve Robertson
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet for the price. Make sure you get the first update for the tablet before you review it. It fixes some lagging issues I noticed when I first got it.

Reviews.Title: A Great Way to Surf The Internet
Reviews.Author: Megen Guest
Reviews.Content: We purchased a similar tablet from AT&T; that required a data plan, and was really disappointed when 5 minutes of time on the internet (not WiFi) used up 1/2 of our data plan.  We sent it back and bought this as a replacement.  It doesnt require a monthly data plan, and it is perfect for surfing the web around the house.  This replaces hubby's old laptop that was 5 years old, and he loves it.  With carpal tunnel, it is easy to hold and not heavy at all.  In the two weeks we've owned it, it has been put on the charger only twice, and that is with hubby using it several hours a day.  We love the little tablet, and enjoy the free apps that are available.

Reviews.Title: Good entry-level tablet
Reviews.Author: Robin "frfall"
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for about two weeks now and am happy with it overall. This is Samsung's replacement for their earlier 10.1 inch tablet which, if you got the 32GB version, cost a lot more. The reason that this is a step-down from the earlier model is because the Samsung Galaxy Note coming out in June will be their premier tablet. However the Note will cost a little over twice what this one costs.If this is your first tablet you will be very happy. It is easy to use, especially for anyone who has been working with an Android smartphone; if you've had a Samsung phone you will find most things work the same as your phone. For any of these products (smartphone / tablet) the best thing to do is pick a platform and stick with it. Having a mix of Apple, Microsoft, etc., will only cost you a lot of money. Once you have purchased apps, music, etc. from one you should stick with that company for your other hardware appliances. It just makes life a lot easier.One big con I have about this tablet is that it is sometimes slow to respond to my selecting a button or key. I've found that you sometimes have to press a button three or more times before it reacts. Music and video playback have been good so far, although I have gotten the occasional skip or pause -- nothing major though.I like the Polaris Office app that comes included as it works with Microsoft Office file formats and makes it easy for me to work on projects while traveling. Another app that is really cool is the Peel Smart Remote. At home I can control my TV and satellite receiver while viewing the on-tablet TV show guide; however, I've found that at a hotel it may control the TV but will default to wanting to connect to a satellite or cable control box, so it doesn't really work at a hotel like I had hoped it would.If you were planning on using this as a digital camera I would advise you to get a real camera. The rear-facing camera is OK, but the one in my phone is MUCH better. The forward-facing camera is great for a video chat; again, handy if you are traveling. The Skype app works great on this tablet.Get a good class 10 micro SD card for storing music, video and data files. There are some inexpensive class 4 micro SD cards out there, but you will not be happy with how they respond.I'm giving this tablet a 4 instead of 5 because of the response issues. A dual-core processor should be able to handle things better. Seems like Samsung is pushing it too hard because of the 10.1 inch screen. In a smaller size tablet (7 inch) it would probably be fine, but Samsung should have put a better processor in this unit.Overall I would rate this a very good starter tablet; good for what you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: from Pandigital to this!
Reviews.Author: 3 Cedars Farm
Reviews.Content: Oh my.  My Pandigital died, so shopping for a new one, I bought the Samsung.  It was like going from a broken down Dodge K car to a Rolls Royce.  I am not a tech specialist, so I have to admit, this is one of the easiest to use gadgets I've ever owned.  Yaaaayyy me!

Reviews.Title: Great 10.1 tablet
Reviews.Author: Patricia McClimans
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. It is my first tablet and I was unsure about it because it isn't inexpensive. It has exceeded all my expectations. I read many reviews before purchasing and was concerned when someone said they couldn't play games on it, I have had no problem playing games. It has a nice big screen and beautiful color to it.

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: BESSIE G INGRAM
Reviews.Content: I really love my Samsung 2 Tablet, it's just like having a small laptop.  I can surf the web and do just about the same things as a laptop plus my tablet is better because it much smaller I can put this in my purse to carry.  The internet and games work pretty fast.  I give this a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: ESITENT
Reviews.Author: mark661
Reviews.Content: I baught this tablet from Costco, knowing I had a full 3o days to test it. I baught it on sale and a great price. I was hard on this tablet thinking that it would not stand up to my tests and I would just have to save and go get an Ipad. This tablet really inpressed me. Out of the box ity picked up my wireless connection and I was online in a minute. The touch screen is great, very well synced. I love this tablet. There is an app, peel the best remote I have ever had. after setting it up it had icons of every thing that on from tv series to movies. Touch the Icon the tv goes right to the movie. and it remembers multible room set up. It has IR built in, so you can download any remote control app. The bluetooth now controls all my music in my house in every room. you can share music and video data with your pc via bluetooth. I have not found one thing with this device that does not work. Great product! Every app that I have downloaded works great. The reason I hesitated to buy it was that I use an iphone and I thought that an Ipad would make more sense. But because iphones are so great I have learned how to use the bluetooth to transfer mp3 files between the two. So now I have the best of both worlds.

Reviews.Title: I am really quite pleased
Reviews.Author: Thomas S. Banghart Jr.
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed Android operating system on my Motorola phone and thought I'd give this a try.  Our family owns an IPad as well.  All around I like this Samsung tab better.  I find the operating system intuitive.  I don't feel tethered to a desktop to sync.  I loaded all my email systems and it's all worked without bugs. The apps have worked great and video streaming's been flawless.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: When I purchased the Galaxy, I wanted an e-reader with email capability. I am getting that much but was surprised to get much more. The camera takes really nice photos, and I was pleased to discover Word / RTF capability, along with widgets that enable me to access my favorite haunts on the NET.

Reviews.Title: I can not put this down!
Reviews.Author: Jason.M.Cook
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday gift to myself this year. I have an Android phone so it does everything my phone does which is great and it is enlarged so you can see and do the same stuff faster. I have downloaded my textbooks for school on the tablet so I can read them at work and on the go. There are Android Apps to share your phones 4G internet with your tablet so even if there are no wi-fi networks available you can still get online on the tablet. The screen is beautiful and vibrant the apps are organized well. The battery life is amazing I only charge the tablet in the car on my way to and from work and school. The processor is fast everything downloads fast with my internet connection. It feels very well built and sturdy the case doesn't move, pop, or bend. I love it and do everything on it from facebook to school work and even this review.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Patti Perez
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Tab is great.  I don't miss having the Apple product and the graphics, sound, everything is good.  It comes on real quick, lightweight and a great size.  Not at all sorry I bought this item.  Researched alot before and it gets great reviews.

Reviews.Title: No fix once it upgrades so turn off automatic upgrades.
Reviews.Author: Peter Fritz
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for 2 years and it worked well until about 2 months ago when Samsung did an auto update which can not be reversed. The nice feature of taking a screen shot is gone, something I used when I traveled,taking google map shots marking hotels, attractions, bus stops etc, email reservations, directions and such.. also there is no down button anymore to get rid of the keyboard once you finish typing something making tapping OK in many sites impossible.The worst part is it does not turn off when you turn it off, it automatically reboots and then you have to turn it off again. Samsung support tells me they are sorry for my frustration and hope a fix will be available someday.

Reviews.Title: Tab It and be DONE!
Reviews.Author: K. Mountjoy "Komical"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this tab and can tell you, it smacks down my iPad 3.  I can do so much more; i.e., because I have an android phone with google account, once I synced with google account in a matter of seconds, everything on my phone was on my tab! Games, contacts, email accounts, etc. We have set up remote television; readers accounts and file manager.  Also, a feature you get with this tab that you dont get with iPad - email accounts allow for us to file our emails as they are set up in Outlook. Not sure what justifies paying $500+ for other tabs, but this one is doing everything (and more to come) that I need right now!Pros:We can watch televisionHook-up to sound systemsExpand memoryAccess Music Manager (google cloud that stores up top 20,000 songs FREE!)Chat with other platformsVibrant screen colorLong lasting battery lifeMulti-screen usageCons:eReader is not as interactive as ePub in iPad, but you can download Aldiku app to remedy that.If you are not familiar with Android platform (I am) there is a learning curve.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Julia Casas
Reviews.Content: This tablet has great technology and you get a lot for the price you pay (refurbished) It's not the newest model but I didn't need that, this one has all the gadgets I needed

Reviews.Title: Happy, but I'm not a "techie", so maybe I am missing something?
Reviews.Author: Booklover Karen "KarenCC"
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, and my first gadget too.  I tried the Kindle Fire last Dec. and was disappointed with all the stuff I seemed to have to purchase and it was slow downloading, which may have been my fault as we rely on spotty wireless in my home, even with a router and repeater.  The Samsung tablet has worked well for me, all I do with it is read using the kindle app, surf the net, use Music Ocean, Craigslist, Weather and Yard Sale Treasure apps.  My 13-year old plays  quite a few games on it.  The tablet was handy on a recent overseas trip where I could take photos and load them instantly to Facebook or another site.  Also very handy to email home from Europe. The tablet was light enough to fit into a cross-body bag and I carried it everywhere. I like having the larger screen.  Maybe there is more I could do with it, but almost a year later, it has worked well, especially for the price.  I bought it refurbished with a 2 year guarantee replacement.

Reviews.Title: Tablet fine, now that it works.
Reviews.Author: WildBill
Reviews.Content: OK I should have know better than to have bought a refurbished unit.  It arrived -microphone did not work. Spent a week determining that it did have a  mlcrophone and there was not an on/off switch I was missing!  Next mistake, I followed insructions in box to "STOP,DO NOT RETURN"  and tried to call NUKO. Spent 2 1/2 days listening to a recording of their office hours, which included when I was calling.  Finally made contact and received RMA number with instructions on how to ship at my expense ($17) the unit back for repair.  Two weeks later functional unit arrived!Summary: Tablet fine,  Purchase process BAD.

Reviews.Title: I love my Sammy!
Reviews.Author: Marang
Reviews.Content: I am a senior, senior, but not too old to love new toys. Am having a great time with my Samsung Galaxy Tab 2. Watched the price go up and down at Amazon  but finally jumped in at $329. Now at $299 it is even sweeter. It is a remarkable tablet with built in GPS and Kindle and so many other features. It is so much more than a toy; it's like holding the world in your hands. It's screen resolution is amazing and the capacitive response is great. I am enjoying exploring and learning and happy I chose the 10.1" size. My transaction with Amazon was smooth and fast; which is always the Amazon way. Buy with confidence!

Reviews.Title: Too many unnecessary factory intalled apps
Reviews.Author: Cho, In-cheol
Reviews.Content: I wish if there are ways to delete most of factory installed applications. I am normally in places where internet is either not available or restricted. I mostly use this tablet with MicroSD card due to storage issue. Other than that, the device is high quality and performs better than I expected. Battery time seems to be shorter than what has been described.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: JohnFTL
Reviews.Content: I'm a late adapter by choice these days and this is my first tablet. I didn't buy it from Amazon because I found it new on sale at a nicely discounted price elsewhere. I bought it just under a month ago and I haven't really had the time to dig into all the features on it but so far I've had no issues with it and I'm loving what I see.  The only thing I didn't know is that the newest versions of Flash isn't compatible with the newer Android OS's. I see that some people are giving this tablet bad reviews because of this, but this problem is very easily solved by downloading an older, archived version of Flash from the Adobe website. That's what I did, and mine now plays internet videos and streams flawlessly. This thing is fast. It has a nice camera and good basic features. I bought a leather case with a blutooth keyboard for it because I hate typing on touch screens, and it works great. It comes with a decent amount of internal memory but I added memory just in case I need it. I love that it is so compact and easy to carry around, and it has a nice heft to it so it doesn't feel light and cheap like some others I've looked at out there. Have to be careful where you put it down though. Its so small and thin that someone could easily steal it and slip in in their jacket or a handbag. This tablet is a thing of beauty. The colors and brilliance of the images on the screen are impressive. I don't have anything bad to say about it at all. I looked at the Ipad before I bought this, and although I'm not knocking Apple (because I own some of their products), to me, this Samsung tablet is a much better value. If you're planning to get a tablet I recommend getting this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet ( College Student)
Reviews.Author: IrishandAwesome "Docjgradyswife"
Reviews.Content: First off, I have owned so many tablets it's ridiculous. I have owned Ipads, Kindles, Nook's, the first version of the Samsung Galaxy Tab 7" 3G, and the list goes on. By far, this is the best tablet I have owned. It works great, the battery lasts forever, the screen is amazing, and it was extremely cheap compared to the price of most other tablets. Google Play store is just as good as the iTunes in my opinion, has pretty much the same apps. I was skeptical when I purchased it because of the older Galaxy Tab I owned, but Samsung has definitely done their homework, and did well with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: My iPads Now Sit Idle
Reviews.Author: Reno J
Reviews.Content: My family owns 3 iPad 2s. I love them. The iPad 2 is a great product. The problem is Apple itself: their DRM restrictions, having to do everything through iTunes, and on and on. The Android Samsung is so easy to use. On a computer, the Galaxy Tab 2 is recognized as an external hard drive & one simply has to drag and drop MP3s or MP4 movie files that have been ripped to the appropriate folder in Windows Explorer - no restrictions. My iPads (as well as my Kindle Fire) have a limited amount of internal storage (16gb for the Apples, 5gb for the Fire). The Samsung has 16gb onboard, but the addition of a microSD card slot of up to 32gb is a godsend - unlimited storage with multiple cards.Screen size: the iPad is more old school TV or computer monitor 4x3 while the Samsung is closer to modern 16x9.Over the last few years, I've bought multiple products (Apple, Archos, Kindle, iHome, etc.), and for the most part they've been good devices, but none of them did everything I wanted them to do in one product until I got the Galaxy Tab 2. It meets all of my requirements. I'm finally completely satisfied with one electronic device. Thank you Samsung. Oh, yeah. The screen quality is great, also.

Reviews.Title: Very versatile
Reviews.Author: Herb Pagel
Reviews.Content: This device does everything I want a tablet for. The only thing I have not been able to do is print from it to a printer connected to another computer on my wireless network. I enjoy numerous apps, and have used the Kindle app the most. The 10.1 inch screen makes reading very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: R. D. Reynolds
Reviews.Content: This thing blows the ipad away I bought the last generation ipad and it sucks. Decided to try the Samsung galaxy tab2 because I have the galaxy 3 phone and I love it. Everything works like it is supposed to and it is so much easier to use than the ipad. Apps are plentiful and easy to download very fast tablet Updated 4-16-13. After using the Samsung tablet for a few weeks now I love it even more.Down loaded some Ebooks and that was easy as pie. I would recommend this to anyone looking to buy a tablet

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: A. Pack "amyjill2002"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband as a Christmas present and he LOVES it.  The best feature is the infared pointer that you can program to control televisions, dvd, cable boxes, etc.  He is in HEAVEN.  Like the other Samsung smartphones I own, the tablet is easy to use, fast, and has lots of features.  Would highly recommend this to anyone, especially if they are on the fence between an android and apple.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy 2 Tab 10.1
Reviews.Author: Larry H
Reviews.Content: This tablet is priced just right and does exactly what I was looking for.  It is able to show my re-encoded Blu-Ray movies with stunning detail.  It responds to user actions in a timely manner.  It does not replace a laptop, but it is a great for entertainment purposes and writing an occasional email or paper.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet and value for money
Reviews.Author: Krishna Kalyanam "Kris"
Reviews.Content: This works great for browsing, watching movies and playing games (for toddler) at my home. I love the ease of use and the Android OS which makes it almost identical to operating any Android phone. It also has a GPS (and turn-by-turn navigation) capability but unfortunately is not of much use since the tab doesn't have 3G or 4G data. You can still use the voice guided navigation if you tether the tab to your mobile phone while driving. The display is great, except that it doesn't support Samsung's S pen (and S note app). For that, you need to buy a newer generation Samsung tab (note).

Reviews.Title: Huge step up from Kindle Fire! Way more pros than cons.
Reviews.Author: J. Straw
Reviews.Content: When my husband was obviously coveting my Kindle Fire, I gifted it to him and picked up the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1" tablet at Costco (it was on sale, but Amazon's current price is even better!).  I really like this tablet!  I use it mostly for reading the news, internet browsing and radio, simple Android games, and checking email.  I'm new to tablets, but getting the hang of 'em.PROS:The browser is plenty fast enoughImages look great on the screenTouch screen very responsiveExpandable memory via microSD cardBluetooth -- great for my Logitech Bluetooth boombox ;-)Quick pop-up in lower right hand corner is VERY convenient  --quick access to WiFi and GPS on/off, Mute, Screen Rotation, adjust screen brightness  --see downloads, new email, battery status, clear list with one tap  --touch the X or anywhere outside the pop-up and Poof, it's goneTapping "Recently Used" icon pops up the recent dozen or so programs/apps for quick access, and buttons for Task Manager and "Remove All"Speakers are quite good (especially compared to the original Fire, LOL)Easy on/off/sleep button and sound up/down button on top edge[added] -- I'm finding that the Samsung version of some apps have more features and are easier to use that the versions developed for the Fire.I considered buying the Fire HD when it came out, but I opted for more memory, bigger screen and a greater selection of apps.CONS:Only 2 complaints really:(1) having the charging port in the bottom edge of the tablet sucks! (one reviewer called it a "brain-dead decision" - yep).  In order to use the tablet while charging, you have to turn it upside-down, making the volume control and on/sleep/off button pretty inaccessible.(2) I am continually aggravated by the lack of precision of the cursor when using the stock email program.  Don't dare go back to correct a typo until completely done with composing the email, because it's impossible to place cursor at the end of your last word to continue onward.Well, maybe a third -- I'd like the earphone jack to beon a lower corner, not bottom or top edge to accomodate the short cable on my iPop speaker.Pretty surprised that I can't get Plants v. Zombies for this tablet.  Not sure where the blame lies there. :-(  With the tablets, you have an umbilical cord -- just depends on what's the least of the evils, IMHO:  Google, Amazon or Apple.All boils down to "Strongly Recommend"

Reviews.Title: Decent Tablet Overall
Reviews.Author: amr88
Reviews.Content: I just bought the Galaxy Tab 2 a couple days ago and have used it a considerable amount. After much research on tablets I decided to go with the Galaxy Tab 2. It does everything I need it to do and is reasonably priced even after buying the SD card.Pros:- Value. Good, quality 10 inch tablet for the money- Speakers on the front- ICS is a pretty good operating system- Battery Life. Maybe not the best out there but I think it gives you respectable battery life for a 10 inch tabletCons:- Picture Resolution (not as clear viewing photos)- Some widgets you can't re-size (at least I haven't been able to resize some of them)- I have yet to get the Amazon app on it. From what I read this is a common problem for some reason- Has some lag in it. I think this is due to the ICS operating system. It seems to do that on every device it is on- A lot of apps can only be used horizontally which leads to the next con...- The screen shape. Using it horizontally is awkwardOverall I think it is pretty good tablet for the money. It's worth buying if you are looking for a quality 10 inch tablet but looking to spend under $400 and still have 32GB of storage. Just remember that this tablet is not an iPad, Nexus 10, or top of the line Asus so don't expect it to be as good as those.

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Tablet is Superior to Kindle FIre
Reviews.Author: David W. Pritchard "Dr David"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is far better than the Kindle Fire.  The visual space is better, colors are better and the processor is much faster - not to mention you're not locked into Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it!
Reviews.Author: Renee McClennon "book worm"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a few months ago and I cannot tell you I love this thing.  I was about to buy an IPAD and I kept looking at the options and what made the difference was the fact the Samsung could plug into the computer and it wasn't as complicated as the IPAD.  I have an IPOD and so many times I'm ready to have someone stand it up so I can do a field goal kick with this thing.  I love this product and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: winner
Reviews.Author: Monty Blanc
Reviews.Content: Great unit.  I am using it constantly.  It has replaced my laptop for internet use and games.  I stilluse the pc for certain ptograms that don't run on the tablet.  Very easy to use.  Good battery life.

Reviews.Title: love this tablet
Reviews.Author: northmn_books
Reviews.Content: Just what I needed. Bought one for my wife who loved it. My son bought one shortly thereafter. I bought one for myself later. My father in law now has one too.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Retired TX Engineer "Louis"
Reviews.Content: I already had a Tab 2 10.1 inch tablet and was very happy with it.  I bought this one for my wife and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: An Apple user decides to try something else and was pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: Celeste Thoms "Moviemaker330"
Reviews.Content: First of all I recommend buying this from Amazon. It is a lot cheaper. I got it for $449 elsewhere.I have been an Apple user for 15 years. I have been hearing so many great things from Android users so I decided to try this device. Here are the things I liked, didn't like, and what I ended up staying with.The expandable hard drive space is a great feature. There are are microSD cards that are 16GB, 32GB and 64GB. I played movies from a 32 GB card and the movies played really well. The video wasn't slow. This to me is the best part about the device because when you buy an iPad you have to choose what you want upfront. Also when you buy a Samsung you get 50GB of cloud storage with Dropbox so you won't really need a card if you didn't want one, but you will of course need wifi or cell service to access the storage.This has a quad core process which means you can multitask and the tablet never slows down. You have the option to have a dual screen or cascade screen where you can have multiple apps opened at once. Just so you know this does not apply to all apps. The interface is really designed. There is a nice selection of apps. Not as many as Apple, but good. It sucked to find out that if you buy an app from Google Play you have only 15 min. to return it and get a refund. So for me the Apple app store is much better and feels more solid than Google and Samsung.The pen is why I chose to try an Android device. Many of them come with a stylus that has a tip that is more like an actual pen. I wanted to sketch on the device and send the drawings to my Adobe Cloud. Drawing with the pen was not a nice experience and I couldn't find the Adobe apps on this device that I used on my iPad. That was disappointing. You have the option to write while the device typed the words out. This seemed like a great feature, but it was annoying. I still had to type some things because it would put spaces between letters and punctuation marks.The screen resolution is clear. I didn't feel like it had a lot of glare to it so that was also nice. I had to put a screen on my iPad to tone down the glare. A plus for the Samsung. When reading a book in portrait view I felt like Moses holding the 10 commandments. This tablet is longer than it looks. Reading in general on this device wasn't great. Holding it in landscape view was better for working and watching movies. Landscape view is the best option for this tablet. The tablet weights slightly less than the larger iPads. It felt really light and I never got fatigued holding it.Coming from Apple it was harder to navigate, but it's not bad once you get the hang of it. Doing simple task takes a few more extra steps than on the iPad. I will say that the PC world has done an excellent job with offering alternatives to Apple products. Either way you choose, Apple or something else you're going to get a great product. The prices are the same. When you look at cheaper alternatives remember they are cheap for a reason. There are missing features. This Samsung Galaxy Tab is the same price you can get the iPad for and the Samsung performs as well as the iPad and has a few extra features anyone will love.In the end I did end up choosing to keep my iPad over this device. I returned the Samsung after 15 hours using it. I honestly got bored with it. I found that the advantages that most people like about the Samsung I found to be just okay. The pen wasn't very good. The external card wasn't useful either because I use Dropbox and Google Drive. My 32GB iPad mini turns out to be more than enough space for me. Like I said, the iPad and the Samsung in terms of functions and features are the same. It all depends on what your preference is and if your preference is anything that isn't an Apple product, then this is a very good tablet for the money.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (10.1-Inch, Wi-Fi)
Reviews.Author: Roger Greenberg "rgreenbe"
Reviews.Content: I had a laptop that finally crapped out and based on reviews, I decided to get this tablet. The 10.1 inch screen is adequate and the WI-FI is great. It paired up perfectly.. The Android system is the same as my Galaxy S3 phone so navigating the tablet is a snap. I can do almost anything that I did with my laptop. I think it's great..

Reviews.Title: Great Little Tablet For Home Or Travel
Reviews.Author: W. Smith
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet for home and travel. Battery lasts forever when traveling and recharges quickly with supplied charger and USB cable. Plenty of expansion with optional 32gb SanDisk Ultra MicroSDHC class 10 memory card I purchased at a great price on Amazon.The forward facing camera has great resoluton for taking pictures and they look great. The rear facing camera is good.The quality of the screen is outstanding. Everything crisp and clear. You can also zoom the screen in and out with the flick of your fingers.My wife and I like this Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 tablet much better than any of the IPads...been there, done that.Because I use this tablet at home so much I also purchased  the GMYLE Black Aluminum 10 inch Bluetooth Wireless Mini Slim Keyboard from Amazon when it was on sale for under $17.00. Has it's own built-in rechargeable battery and comes with a USB cord for recharging.I also purchased a Samsung Universal Tablet Desktop Dock EDD-D100BEGXAR from Amazon at half the price Samsung wanted. This Dock is an OEM Samsung product. Works great when I use the tablet as a mini PC at home.Purchased the Samsung USB & SD Connection Kit EPL-1PLRBEGSTA from Amazon. Again the price was less than the price Samsung wanted and all the contents were OEM Samsung products.Both the Dock and Connection Kit connectors fit the Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 connector perfectly and were easy to disconnect from the tablet.I purchased the i-BLASON Leather Case Cover in black that fits this tablet like a glove. All necessary areas of this case cover necessary to access the tablet controls and access points are available. This is a premium leather case and is well made. The case also comes with a good Stylus at no extra charge. This was also on sale at Amazon for under $12.00.This Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 is a great little tablet and my wife and I find ourselves using them much more than our laptop or desktop computers.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: D.K
Reviews.Content: I brought this tablet as a replacement for a Asus Memo Pad that broke twice and I had was not willing to try a third one. Overall, not a bad tablet.  The sound quality is quite good.  Better than the Asus. Two major draw back is where they put the SD card slot and the power plug. They would have been better on the side.  It's kind of difficult to take the SD card in and out when you have the tablet in the case.  The other problem is that the power plug is on the bottom of the tablet.  So it makes it difficult to charge the tablet as you are watching a movie. Over time I think the USB cord will have to be replaced because the tension will cause the USB cord to brake. When compared to the Asus Memo pad (279.99) this has a slower processor and I believe less RAM. But the Asus tablet has a issue with dying on you. Also the Tab 2 blocks apps not downloaded from Google.  So you have to change this in the settings. But if you can catch this tablet on sale for 299.00 like I did then it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Love my Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Gayla Allen
Reviews.Content: This tablet does everything my husband's ipad does, except the ipad takes better videos and pictures, and you can't zoom in to take a closer picture.  It has lots of other great features thought that have made it worth having.

Reviews.Title: Versatile, feature-packed tablet
Reviews.Author: My Stuff "Sheri"
Reviews.Content: I use my Samsung Galaxy Tab to check email, update/visit social sites and to do some light word processing. It also holds my photos while I'm on vacation. I bought a card reader that plugs right in and I take the SD card out of my camera and transfer the photos to the tablet. I've used it's GPS features to locate places on maps and the screen is easier to see than a small GPS or phone. The Android operating system makes it work just like my phone--easy to use, versatile, and lots of apps available. I also use it to Skype, making it great for trips away from home. The upward-facing speakers make music sound incredible. I checked out the specs and compared it to other tablets and I know I made the right decision. I won't go into that here, there are other reviews that do a great job discussing features. I'm just telling you that I love it and am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: WILL ACCEPT 64 GB micro SD cards!
Reviews.Author: scarygary
Reviews.Content: Let me END the talk over whether or not the SAMSUNG GALAXY TAB 2 10.1 will accept the new 64 GB micro SD cards.  In a nutshell, The TAB 2 WILL mount up and allow the use of the 64 GB card!  I put one in MY TAB 2, did a quick check of the "storage" page in the "settings" menu, and THERE IT WAS, ready to use.  If you get one, make sure that you TURN YOUR TABLET OFF before installing the card, then turn it ON normally to get the tablet to recognize it.  The SANDISK 64 GB card is only $52 on AMAZON.  Don't make the mistake of getting the cheaper ($22) no-name cards available on AMAZON!  they are usually counterfeit, and likely do not have 64 GB of memory on them.  If the no-name ones even load up, they pretty much always have CONSIDERABLY less memory than the amount stated in the AD.  I bought a couple of 16 GB no-names once, and they actually had 2 GB on them, and constantly gave errors when transferring data.  Stick with the name-brand and you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Another great investment for Shimmy.
Reviews.Author: Shimmy
Reviews.Content: Another great investment for Shimmy. I love this this lil thing. Screw Ipad and Apple. I love Samsung. It makes my life simple when networking.

Reviews.Title: Samsung galaxy Tab 2
Reviews.Author: Antonette T. DeLuca
Reviews.Content: I bought it because the screen was big enough to read easily, and it was affordable.  I wish there was a more complete manual with it because I know it has functions that I don't know how to use.  Guess I will have to ask a child to show me.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Loves Amazon "Luvkids"
Reviews.Content: I have this tablet along with the iPad 2. Both are great products. This tablet is worth the money. I absolutely enjoy it. I also have the Vizio Tablet which I would recommend to no one. I love this tablet; it was worth the money and is more affordable than iPad 2.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Bellablue
Reviews.Content: After pouring over reviews for a lot of different tablets i kept coming back to this one so when it was on special i just decided to go for it.It is a nice weight and size for me as i have poor eyesight and needed a larger screen. I can see this one just fine. I never had a tablet before so I am still learning and exploring the possibilities of this little wonder.So far i am very pleased and would recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: love my tablet
Reviews.Author: Danielle Harrell "~A Woman Like Me~"
Reviews.Content: I knew that i didn't want another apple product so I started looking for android tablets. I went to my local electronic stores to play around and fell in love with the galaxy tab 2. I knew that it would be used just like my itouch for movies, games and music. Netflix works well and so does hulu+ I read reviews of hulu+ not working but haven't had any issues yet. Overall, I really do love my tablet and I will update my review in a few months.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet supports Flash but be careful with Android updates and SD Cards
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is a good overall budget tablet from Samsung. Most of what I think of it has already been said in the prior positive reviews and I did this review primarily to add a little info that some might find useful.1. Adobe flash WILL work. You have to download the the latest flash from a third party, install it and use a browser that supports flash (stock browser, Dolphin, Firefox). Chrome, unfortunately, does not support flash so it's a no go. Just do a google search for more details. Works fairly well but has some issues.2. IMPORTANT If you have a micro SD card loaded make sure you unmount if before updating the Android operating system. If you don't there's a good chance it won't work after the update. Mine was set to automatically update and after the update to Jelly Bean and subsequent reboot my tablet would no longer read my card correctly (reads fine in other devices though).Update: 1/6/14I'm still impressed with this device and have had no major issues. It has, however, slowed down since the update to ICS 4.2.2 and is not quite as zippy as it once was. For anyone interested in USB audio out, I tried to get this working with an OTG cable, Hifimedia DAC, headphones and USB pro audio player. It sorta works. It plays the audio but frequent pops and other glitches make this non viable. It's almost there and maybe, with updates to the UPAP, it will be in the future.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2
Reviews.Author: PP "pp"
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for the money! Everything works well and it comes with many great apps. I purchased the tablet for my parents who never before used computers or tablets. They are constantly using it. I played with the tab for a few hours using; Zillow.com, Google Map and Gmail. Easy to use, but Google Map street view is difficult to navigate. Gmail looks different, does not have the same look as if you were to open Gmail on a computer. It comes with Polaris Office suit, which allows you to use; Word, Excel, and Resume helper. Overall, great product. keyboard is just superb.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1
Reviews.Author: Randall Cummings
Reviews.Content: I have spent the last 2 yrs watching and evaluating Tablets and I find that the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 meets all of my needs.  I am not a gamer but I have been enjoying watching my Grand kids play on it.  Their mother has an Apple and my Grandson says this is much better and easier to use, I have to take his word for it.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I like it because its compact and easy to carry around. I was surprised how fast it connects to the internet. There is also an app to turn it into a telephone. The GPS is great to.

Reviews.Title: Product of excellence
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M. Oconnor
Reviews.Content: This tablet met all my expectations and more. I was so glad to find something that was as good as the Ipad and not be a prisoner of all their limitations.  I can pick and choose what I want.  Absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wow it looks and works great. I was worried on several  levels. But that was waisted time.. this thing is great...Amazingly fast , crystal clear display, and the most important thing of all IT IS NOT AN APPLE PRODUCT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: J Dyer
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome tablet. The screen resolution is incredible, it's fast enough to handle all kinds of applications, and the speakers are good enough to not require headphones. Samsung also has some really neat applications (like the one that lets you remote control your TV), and my husband really likes it. Best of all, it is light enough carry around on a daily basis. I got a great deal, and we are very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: MN Barn Godess
Reviews.Content: I bought my Samsung 10" Galaxy Tablet to replace my Samsung 7" Galaexy Tablet. I found the frequency I was using it to search the web, e-mail and Social Networking, I did not really like a smaller tablet. I gae my 7" Tablet to my daughter, who enjoys using one tablet for reading vs the Kindle and the Nook seperately. I also have both the Kindle and Nook downloaded on my tablet. I use it for listening to music, storing pictures as well as videos. I was impressed with the fast delivery service after it was ordered. I would recommend the Samsung Galexy Tablet to anyone waivering over a tablet such as this vs an iPad! It has been proven to be very user friendly!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift for my 14 year old son.  He previously had a little netbook that died.  He loves this tablet!  I have used it quite a bit myself as well.  It's a great size and the Android apps are great! Purchased a stand up cover to go with it to protect it.  Definitely recommend it over Ipad!

Reviews.Title: Just Perfect
Reviews.Author: Heberto Ocando
Reviews.Content: No comments about it,  just perfect. Don't waste your money in other tablets brands, you won't regret. If you need a tablet, get this one as soon as you can

Reviews.Title: GRATE TABLET
Reviews.Author: Roger R Litscher
Reviews.Content: WORKS GREAT. DOES MORE THEN I CAN. A LITTLE SLOW COMMING ON BUT NO PROBLEM. GRATE SCREEN SHARP AND CLEAR. THEY COULD GIVE A LONGER CORD!

Reviews.Title: A great tablet!
Reviews.Author: rainbow16
Reviews.Content: I love my 7" Samsung Galaxy Tablet but wanted to get the larger screen since I work crossword puzzles a lot and didn't want to have to keep swiping the screen to see the whole puzzle along with the clues and keyboard.  There are other reasons that I wanted a larger screen but won't list them all here...just know this, bigger is better.  This tablet did not disappoint.  It does come with some apps that my smaller tablet does not have and it works great.  I love my tablets and could not be more happy with the Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: THIS IS A KEEPER!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I traded my ipad 2 in for the Samsung tab 2.  I do alot of reading and the ipad was just too heavy. I have to say the ipad just felt clunky and heavy compared to the lighter and slimmer Samsung. I'm very pleased with the color and the speed. With 2 large speakers on the front sides, the sound is great. This is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: Wow !!!
Reviews.Author: Jeana
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased to see that my tablet was shipped without any issues. I am beyond excited about the tablet. It is extremely awesome! I first wanted to get the iPad as most people do... then I realized the pros to having Samsung vers iPad. Not only does it connect to my smart tv, with extra memory , but it extremely similar. It has the same apps, camera quality is great, battery life is great. I am I guess u would say computer illiterate but this tablet is beyond easy to figure out and enjoy! I hope this helps and hope it's terrific like mine :)

Reviews.Title: Could not have made a better choice for a tablet
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: I thought the size would be way too big, but it is perfect. From reading other reviews, it would be a monster to carry around but it's quiet the opposite. The color graphics are excellent and the screen is perfect for reading, writting, and playing games. Right out of the box it was a working machine. I have not done a lot with it, as it is my daughter's Christmas present but my test run was everything I expected. I was undecided between the Kindle Fire HD and this tablet......this one won! I read several reviews comparing the two, asked questions from other buyers, researched different forums and this tablet had what I needed and more. I hope I continue to be a happy owner of this tablet, or at least my daughter.....and if so, I may purchase another one later on down the road. Great product Samsung.  Also, the seller has excellent communication and stays on top of any concerns and that is a big plus. I am open to any suggestions and/or tips on navigating, do's and dont's, and any other informational hints that will make this experience better.

Reviews.Title: Everything great so far
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: No problems except once it seemed to crash and not turn on again about a month after I owned it.  I think it was because I never re-started it since I bought it.  I looked on line and others had the same issue, you need to hold both the volume and power key for about 10 seconds and it turns on fine.

Reviews.Title: Love everything about but one tiny issue...
Reviews.Author: Chode
Reviews.Content: I actually got this item over the Newest Ipad for three reason... 1.Cost... The Galaxy on the whole is about $100 less then Ipad. 2. Additional Memory... Galaxy offers you the option to insert a SD CARD Ipad doesn't 3.Flash... Galaxy claimed to run it and Ipad doesn't. Problem is though that since the upgrade to the 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich OS Google no longer wants to support it. Which means a lot of videos on the Web are unwatchable. So other then Flash Capabilities this is an amazing piece of equipment that I now use Dailey if not hourly.

Reviews.Title: Highgate
Reviews.Author: Paraclete
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 is sweet.  I bought it for my husband's 60th birthday he just loves it.  Love the two speakers on it.  It is flexible.  It is great for his meetings instead of his laptop.  Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: review samsung galaxy 2
Reviews.Author: bc
Reviews.Content: this tablet works great, but ,does not have a adobe flash to play some video . that why it is not 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Sara Mayes
Reviews.Content: I like the easy use and features of this tablet. I am already google/ android oriented so this was an easy process and start-up for me. I would recommend this for anyone who is an Android user. Great clarity and the extra SD slot for expanded memory is helpful for more apps.

Reviews.Title: BEST ANDROID  Tablet
Reviews.Author: FH
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this tablet. It is the best ANDROID tablet on the market. It is equal to an IPAD but it is Android. I have used both and I prefer to have this Samsung Android Tablet over IPad; especially since I have an IPhone.

Reviews.Title: Piece of garbage - Dont waste your money
Reviews.Author: JimInSacramento
Reviews.Content: This item has been defective since the day i bought it and Samsung keeps trying to fix it with no success. The tablet itself works fine but it eats up SD cards. I know that is bizarre. Lots of Android forum users have experience the same problem. Accourding to Samsung, I am the only person in the world that has had this problem. Music and pictures I copied to the SD card disappear randomly. then i got a message saying my SD card was blank and should be formatted. I sent the Tablet back to Samsung after 2 months and they re-imaged the tablet and returned it to me. it worked for 2 more months and then it damaged my SD card, and the SD card is now unreadable in any device i have, Phone, camera and Laptop. My 12 month warranty is about to run out and the Samsung Executive Customer Rep will not commit to Samsung standing behind their product for this problem. Ok, fine $349 down the toilet. No More Samsung Products for Me!!update 10/22/2013 - since last repair, unit will not hold a charge for more than 3 days even without use!!

Reviews.Title: Item was not new as was advertised.
Reviews.Author: Jason Whittington
