Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2
Reviews.Author: G. Goldstein
Reviews.Content: We bought this item to replace an iPad that suddenly failed.  There was not good reason for the iPad to fail, as it was never abused and hardly ever left our home.  My wife was typing away on her iPad when it suddenly FROZE.  The Apple Genius diagnosed the problem as a failure of the internal Sold State Drive.  No reason given and 2 months after the warranty ended.  So I researched options to replace it.  Best option was to sell the nonfunctioning unit on Gazelle ($68) and apply that to purchase a new Galaxy Tab 2.  The Tab 2 is every bit as nice as the iPad.  It's about the same weight and size and similar battery life.  The screen is slightly higher res on the Tablet too.  One thing we like better about the Tab 2 is that it functions more like a PC.  No need to stumble through iTunes for those of us who prefer PCs.  You can add files and move them just like you can on a PC.  It has more memory because of the SIM card that can be added and it's less costly than an iPad.  Frankly, as an owner of Apple stock, I don't know why they haven't improved the iPad more after all these copy cat products came out.  They ought to at least offer USB support, something missing from both of these tablets.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab(tm) 2 10.1 (Wi-Fi) 16GB ~ GT-P5113
Reviews.Author: Charlie Warren
Reviews.Content: I liked my Samsung Galaxy S Fascinate, and I like the Galaxy S4.  Basically, if you're happy with Samsung, then you'll love this, and maybe even if you're an Apple Fan.  The Price is right.  The Twin Speakers on the Sides are Pretty Good, not Over Powering, but you're going to plug in your Stereo Earphones on the plane anyhow.  Wi-Fi works wonderfully, and tethers from another Cell Phone well.  The 1080 HD Screen is very Sharp and Crisp with Vibrant Colors.  There's not much of a Camera here, but I bought it to view in the Living Room while watching TV, and find out the Filming Location on IMDb, and to Track Shipments and to read Email.  Once, you get a Tablet, you wonder how did you survive without one, and then you find that no matter how big your Cell Phone's Screen is, it's nothing compared to viewing anything on the 10 inch Tablet, I take the Tablet to Church, and read from Olive Tree's Bible with a Lexicon from Spiros Zodhiates Complete Study Bible, or I Tether it to my Cell Phone and my family Watches SlingBox in the car.  With Sywpe or Google Voice Typing or other Speech to Text Recognition Software, you almost don't need a KeyPad anymore.The Amazon Tablet app works on this Tablet, but let's just say Bye-bye to the No-Frills, No Icons Limited Page Mobile Apps, and you'll be glad to note that you can run everything including Amazon on this Tablet in it's Native Internet Explorer or Google Chrome Window, with Full Pictures and such. And you can set BookMarks on the New Internet Page.  The Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 is running Android Version 4.1.1, (Jelly Bean#, so it does all the Tricks you're used to, like organizing Folders, and bringing up all Active Apps.  Reading with Kindle or watch a YouTube Video is so more better than on the Cell Phone.  The Unlock Screen gives you Four Choices, Google Search Plus Weather, Tracking, Stocks ; Video Gallery, Internet, Picutre Gallery.  And this Comes with AccuWeather, and it's pretty easy to set up several different Email Accounts.  The 1.0 Dual Core Processor seems fast so far.Cons:Old School DOS Structure is gone, and is a little more Difficult to go to a Drive just using the Drive Letter. Example, #instead of just switching from C:\Users\Public\Documents to J:\Users\Public\Documents, I now have to go to the Drive 1st to Computer\GT-P5113\Card\Users\Public\Documents#.  I had to Change some of my BackUp Batch Files to represent the new File Structure.You probably want to get a Leather Case for it, as the back was Slippery and it's sort of heavy.  CrazyOnDigital Stand Leather Case with Charger and Screen Protector For Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 #6-item#The Calulator is not as Good as I would Like, but it's the Stock Samsung Calculator, #I use and highly Recommend getting the RDev Calculator App).It was nice to have the Alarm Clock back with the "Good Morning" Melody, as I had gotten my Cell Phone prior to the Samsung Galaxy S III, so I have a Motorola Droid RAZR MAXX, and I had to import the "Good Morning" Melody into it and had DownLoaded Alarm Clock Extreme, so I now got both.Which reminds me, The Cool thing is that all my Apps that I had DownLoaded started DownLoading to the Tablet, and except for SlingBox, which had a different App for the Android Tablets than for the Android Cell Phones.and I didn't have to reinstall all my Bible Apps.  I did have to put in the User ID and Password,And I put a SanDisc 64Gb Ultra Micro SDXC in mine, and the Tablet picked it up and runs fine even in the exFat Format, now I have 80Gb.  Awesome to the Max~!  I may even buy another Sumsung Galaxy Tab~!

Reviews.Content: Like every other gadget in the universe, once you have it you find all kinds of uses for it you never imagined! I have the wireless version but I "tether" it to my Samsung smartphone so when I am away from my home/office I can access the internet and show the photos posted on my blog and website in all their glory. But sad to say, I am now addicted to playing solitaire and mahjongg in bed before falling asleep... probably should not have shared that! It is also just the right size for reading magazines I subscribe to electronically. And I can stream TV shows and movies in my hotel room or anywhere in the house or out of it. It is so lightweight I can slip it in my bag and I don't even know it is there. As I knew I was going to be getting a smartphone (just got it a week ago) I really wasn't sure if I needed a tablet too, but I am really happy I bought it.

It has been very reliable and I am 100% sold on buying refurbished items.  I saved quite a bit of money compared to buying new, and I feel like it's better than new because it's been double-checked to work correctly.  I'm very happy with my purchase, but will probably upgrade to a full windows tablet in the future with fewer compromises.  Also, I purchased a cheap stylus off Amazon that works great on my girlfriends Kindle HD, but it requires a lot of pressure and is awkward to use on my Tab 2 - I can't tell you why that is, but it's worth noting.

Reviews.Title: First tablet, and so far, my daughter likes it a lot

There are many apps to help her talk, read and write, and that is the main reason why we got it.The screen colors are OK, the apps are abundant, the sound is not bad, and the battery life is great (it lasts longer than my PC).  One small annoyance is the need for support when you are watching a movie.  If I do that in my laptop, I just place it on my lap and watch the movie.  For the tablet, I have to hold it all the time on its position, so you better purchase a case if your use will be done over an extended time.The processing power is not what I expected.  Apps load and run faster on my iPhone, however the capability of running multiple apps at once is great.  I am not sure if this lack of processing power is similar in other tablets.Overall, a good buy for the price, but Samsung needs to enhance the customer experience.

The games are all scaled up and I often found it daunting since I my field of vision has to be broader in order to see everything!  it is much easier on a smaller screen.  However, viewing movies and videos is much much nicer than on a smartphone.  The browser is somewhat lame since I am used to Chrome and many functions (like favoirtes) don't seem to be there (maybe I need to spend more time finding out where functions are).  All in all, a nice additon to my wi-fi enabled toys.

The 16gig internal is kind of small, but I bought a 32gig card to go with it and that will work well for me. The Smart Peel app is just great, better than the guide on DirecTV for the most part.Don't buy the "Frequently Bought Together" package that Amazon recommends, you will not like the cheap, and I mean cheap Bluetooth keyboard. Consumer Reports listed the Galaxy Tab 2 as a great value and recommendation.3. We planned on using it for email, browsing the web, and watching videos and are not heavy gamersAfter using the tablet for a month or two, we love the look and feel. The picture is clear and bright and the sound is decent.The battery life is great, my kids can spend a couple hours watching videos and it will still be at 85% power.Every game we've downloaded has run smoothly and works perfectly. The kids have a blast with it.I have tried the iPad 2 and 3 and must say that it is much faster and more responsive than the Galaxy, however it is also $200 more.The Galaxy can use a micro SD card so memory is not an issue. Also, with the latest Android update, the screen has been much more responsive and everything is loading faster. Browsing works great and so does email. I use an iPhone and love the iOS operating system, but after using Android I must say it is just as good (maybe better if you consider that you can use 3rd party apps to do almost anything).All in all, it's a great deal if you want a table to leave in the kitchen for calendar, looking up recipies at dinner, or moderate gaming with the kids. I have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG, Are You Mad At Me???
Reviews.Author: GLM
Reviews.Content: I've always enjoyed owning and using Samsung devices, and my meager bank account will attest to the fact that I have purchased far too many.This most recent  Galaxy Tab 2 purchase was a nightmare.  First, the tablet ran hot.  I mean cook up some bacon on the back of it hot.  Constantly dropped the wifi signal everywhere.  The screen would freeze and then go into "lala land" Mode so often that I thought perhaps NSA had recovered some ancient negative comment I may have made and accidentally sent it to Samsung.Seriously, it appears that I received the official lemon of lemons version.  Returning it to Amazon was painless and now I'm looking for another tablet, perhaps a Windows 8 OS.This has been my singular and specific experience with an obviously defective tablet.  No doubt your  experience will vary.

Reviews.Title: Really dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Edson Manners
Reviews.Content: I REALLY wanted to like this product. My girlfriend bought it for me for christmas 2012 after doing a ton of research that I didn't know about. Usually I would be horrified if she bought me any electronics but when I opened the SGT2 10.1 (5113) and set it up I almost proposed on the spot. First some background, I recently completed my Masters in Comp. Sci I wanted an android tablet to do some software development. At first glance the tab hit a home run. The IR port made me dizzy with happiness, the micro-SD slot caused a single, glistening tear of joy to roll down my cheeks, youtube worked out of the box, and my private collection of classic movies (streamed over my home network) never looked better. The last time my GF saw me on Christmas day was two minutes after I opened my SGT2 10.1.But then issues started to rear their ugly heads. During the initial setup Android decided to install all of the apps that I use on my Nexus One on the SGT2. For reasons I can't explain this immediately caused the Tab to lose sound and the ability to play all videos (they'd be extremely choppy with no sound). After googling around I did a factory reset and did *not* let Google sync my android devices. The video problem did not (immediately) come back.Then I decided to make use of the IR port. Samsung has an IR remote control app, it's name I've now forgotten, that comes with the Tab that I used to configure my Denon Audio receiver, my Tivo HD, my Samsung Bluray player and my Mitsubishi DLP TV. They all worked well enough but not perfect. I'll give it say a B- but it wasn't a deal killer. I figured if Samsung didn't get it's act together I'd write a remote control android app myself.Then after about 8 hours of using the tab for everything under the sun, the battery was still only at 40%, amazing, but I didn't want to run out of juice so I figured I'd plug it in while I kept working/playing. Samsung in their wisdom decided to send what feels like a 1ft power cable with the device. I say 1ft because I could not find one place in my house where I could have the Tab plugged in *and* use it at the same time. To make matters worse, samsung does *not* seem to sell an official Samsung 6-8ft cable. The only one's I could find were 3rd party and I don't really like using $0.99 third party junk on my $400 tab. Of course non of this would be a problem if samsung stopped using garbage proprietary connecters and just went standard micro-usb with docking pins.So I ended up using the device on the ground while plugged in and started looking for  the accessories that I'd need: docking station, HDMI adaptor and a case.I'll start with the docking station. After begin totally frustrated with how difficult it was to find the official Samsung dock for this device I decided to just buy the Samsung Galaxy Desktop Dock (EDD-D1B1BEGXAR) Turns out that it's only compatible with the SGT (1) 10.1 and *not* the SGT2 10.1. It ALMOST fits for the SGT2 but not actually. You can force it if you like but this is the reason I like looking for official devices so that they just work.Next was the HDMI adaptor Samsung EPL-3PHPBEGXAR Galaxy Tab HDTV Adapter. It turns out that's it's a lesson in frustration. Not only did samsung, in their total lack of wisdom, not include the HDMI connector in the dock but they don't make it clear that it doesn't work on all SGT2's only the 5113 model has the HW for a second display. This I learnt at the XDA forums. So even though I got lucky, as a developer something else snagged me that I haven't been able to  find anywhere else on the net. When I plug the HDMI adaptor in the Tab doesn't see both data and power, only power. Which made it impossible to do USB debugging during android development.Now this minor detail doesn't concern most tablet users but what should concern anyone looking at purchasing this tablet or any other devices from samsung is that even the Samsung app store stuff didn't download after notifying me of an update. Everything Samsung related on the Tab feels like it wasn't thoroughly tested. There is a consistent level of not-quite-ready with the experience that I've had with this tab that is clearly on the Samsung side of things. I'm pretty much invested in the Google ecosystem and want to continue down that path, even though I do have the iPod and a macbook pro is my daily machine. But at this point there is a noticeable lack of quality control that Samsung has that is sorely needed.This tablet is close enough in HW specs to challenge anything out there, however Samsung is not yet ready to be the big boy in town yet, they are the best that Android has to offer outside of the Nexus line. So I'll be getting my refund and holding on to my (girlfriend's) money until I can find something better.

Reviews.Title: Good for the most part
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: In order to cut the price by $100, this tablet has lower hardware spec than the first generation Samsung 10-inch tablet.  For example the front-facing camera is VGA vs 2Mpx.  The new one is 0.38 inches thick as opposed to 0.34 inches in the previous gen.  I bought it anyway because it comes with Android 4 (Ice Cream Sandwich).  The first generation still ships with Android 3 (Honeycomb).  For the most part, I am happy with the tablet.Good:This tablet has surprisingly few pre-installed apps which cannot be removed.Bad:The charging cord is only 3 feet long. The tablet barely reaches my kitchen countertop when plugged into a wall outlet.  Why so short?Samsung added a button for taking screenshots next to Home/Back.  I clicked on it a few times by accident.  I cannot think of a reason for me to use it.  If this feature is so desirable, Google would have baked it into the Android 4 OS.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet and I love it!
Reviews.Author: Hexum
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend is going out of town and wanted an e-reader. After doing some research I found the Galaxy 2 7 inch was only $50 more than the Kindle Fire (which is limited). Why not go full out Android Ice Cream for that price difference. I bought her one, and the kid in me was probably more excited than she was to play with it. What an awesome machine! The Peel app works wonderful, turns my tv on, changes inputs, and changes channels. I was so impressed that I went out and purchased the 10.1 for myself. I am familiar with the Android os and feel very comfortable using it. In time they will have plenty more tablet apps I am sure, developers would be stupid not to create them. Everything from the crispness of the screen to the weight are great. I would suggest this tablet to anyone who is in the market. I don't think you will be disappointed.If you have any questions about it I will check back periodically and answer them to the best of my ability!

Reviews.Author: TCatone
Reviews.Content: I have had the Samsung galaxy tab 2 10.1 for only a few days and I love it already. Coming from an iPhone user I already love the android operating system better! Things I found were really good (that I found questionable reviews on) was the sound, I was actually impressed with it, it sounds clear and loud. The user friendly-ness isn't bad, if you are not tech savvy no worries you will catch on pretty fast. The system is lighting fast and again impressed with operating system such as how pages and apps open and close. I wasnt overly impressed with the picture quality but would still rate it on the high end. I would highly recommend this to someone looking for a good deal, reasonable price, and awesome quality without getting suckered in to buy Apple.Lastly the only cons I have found is - it only has micro SD slot, so I will be buying an adapter soon for file transfers.

Reviews.Content: I travel a whole bunch and I love the fact that I don't need to carry 5 pounds of laptop to stay connected.  I use a Tab 2 7" out and about during the day because it fit's snugly in my cargo pants.  However, my plan is to use this in the hote to download the days photos and return emails.

Reviews.Title: Always disappointing.
Reviews.Author: J. Robinson
Reviews.Content: This tablet was a gift, for which I am grateful. It was very thoughtful. However, it seems every time I want to use it for something, there is always some kind of limitation that prevents it from performing as well as I would like it to. When I first got it, I thought it would change my life! But, in reality, it sits in a closet, useless.My first disappointment was realizing there is no reasonable way to use it in class to take notes. Samsung did a very good job of making sure one must buy the Galaxy NOTE Tab (or an iPad) for that function.Second disappointment: I haven't been able to find a decent keyboard to use with it. It's not an iPad, so it seems to me desirable accessories are few and far between. And, anyway, my laptop keyboard works great.Third disappointment: I haven't been able to figure out how to connect it to my TV. I was hoping I would be able to use it to watch HBO Go on a TV.Fourth disappointment: There is no USB nor Mini-USB slot.Fifth disappointment was learning this tablet cannot scan barcodes. It has a 3-megapixel fixed-focus camera. Because of those limitations, the camera is unable to focus on barcodes, therefore, unable to scan them. There is supposedly a workaround of putting a magnifying glass over the tab's lens. Ridiculous.The one somewhat useful function I once used it for was to download and read a digital version of a fiction book required for class. I am PRETTY SURE it will work as a Point of Sale cash register (but without being able to scan items). It also has a cool factor, which keeps hope alive that someday I will be able to find a significant use for it. But, overall, there doesn't seem to be much point to having this tablet. I can't think of anything to do with it that I can't already do on my smart phone and/or laptop.

Reviews.Title: I loved it....then it let me down!!
Reviews.Author: Lynn
Reviews.Content: When I purchased this tablet for my son's 5th birthday I was super happy. He had it for two weeks, he droped it once and it wouldn't come on. A couple days later it came on and then it shut off again. Remind you this tablet was refurbish. It stayed off for about a week then i decided to give amazon a call. I spoke with techs yesterday 8/19/2013 they said that it may be the charger due to other customers have complained about the chargers. So, they are going to send new charger and hopefully this will fix the problem.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 Instruction Book?
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Barton
Reviews.Content: I need a more complete instruction book. The small one that came with the tablet is unbelievably short and inadequate.

Reviews.Title: re-orientation!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Burtt "Sandra"
Reviews.Content: Coming from an office/all-in-one mindset this samsung android hybrid takes a lot of getting used to, a lot of jumping through hoops to accomplish tasks that used to just require pressing the "enter" key.  If (as in since) Microsoft has the skinny on word, excell and powerpoint, and if it's the business standard, then all computer systems should be compatible across the board, because even I outside of the office environment still conduct business and push documents.  I shouldn't have to download strange samsung office software, that is "like" or "converts" Microsoft applications.  Downloading a samsung app I.e., lowes, shrinks the size of print and pictures, and a whole load of debilitations occur.  I'm not a game player, nor do I ever expect to be.  Samsung is loaded, loaded, loaded with game apps, I'll never use.  Checking status of accounts, reading, shopping, very minute tasks are a breeze, the battery life is long.  In the begining I kept receiving update notices for every app.  How outdated can they be??? I did manage to down load eprint from hewlett packard wireless printing, otherwise printing is not accomodated unless it's via a samsung printer.  *** 4 out of 5 in my household have ipod touch, they say my tablet is weird, odd ball I know, but when the two year warranty ends and this dies .... actually before it dies, I just might go ahead and get full size HP.  It's always easier to get used to more than less .... I want more, I want more!  Don't discount the positive reviews, it may suit your purposes supremely.  At a time when we think we're at the height of technological progress ... there are those who produce software according to what is right in their own minds.  On an occasion when I considered downloading an app a little robot appears if I choose it a window appears and essentially says samsung does not approve it .... on an other occasion of a download it  asked "prove to me you're not the robot." ; )

It works well for reading articles and it works well for using apps, but it really depends on the quality of the app, and in my opinion, the Play Store is not as strong as the Apple Store. Anyways, it is useful, but not optimal.

Reviews.Title: Great, but does have some minor flaws
Reviews.Author: Master Angelus "Slasher Troll"
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift for Christmas, but I asked for it so I did some research. First off, I was promised Flash support (full support for Adobe Flash Player 10.1 for accessing Flash-enabled websites), but that was when Ice Cream Sandwich was out, but Jelly Bean was fast on its way. Now Adobe has pulled its support, unless you just don't want to update your tablet. There are workarounds, but it entails installing rogue APKs and then they only work with certain apps.I tried to like the built-in Samsung keyboard, but not with its native Swype. So I downloaded the Swype Beta app and it's awesome! I used to have an iPad and absolutely hated having to tap out words and worry about auto-correct. Now, I can slide my finger around the virtual keyboard. You may still have to add your personal words, and it will offer to save them in its built-in dictionary. Hey, it's one of those rogue APKs, but it works on pretty much all software in the tablet, so I'm good.This tablet is about the price and specs comparable of a used iPad 2. But it's much more open-source as far as adding your music, photos, apps and videos. You can either use Kies or simply plug your tablet up to the USB slot of your computer and drag them over. Also, the microSD can handle a 64GB card! I took my card out of my Galaxy S3 and popped it in with no problems. All of my music was there and it reported correctly storage usage and space available.Now for the cons: Every once in awhile, the edges feel a little loose like there's a bit of screen separation. Sliding it into a case helps big time. But the charging jack is on the side and facing the inside spine of the case. This means that you have to leave your case open when charging and it can get dusty. Also, there is a dreaded copy/paste bug that has plagued Samsung devices for over a year now. Your device will randomly soft reboot after a copy/paste or just crash altogether. There are other occasional crashes and freezes, but they're very rare, at least in my case.I did have one problem during setup: don't change the time-zone so that it can set itself up. If you do, you will get an internal clock error. Just let it do its thing and then when you login to your Google account, it will auto update your clock and Sync up everything. All in all, not a bad tablet but if they'd fix the bugs and I had guaranteed Flash or HTML5 websites then I'd bump it up another star.

Reviews.Content: really liked this tablet so far.  Having no problems- I haven't installed netflix on it yet, but I have watched videos and played lots of games and it works great

Netflix streams smoothly..never had a problem with either that or any other streaming service (Amazon Prime, Movie Tube etc). The volume is somewhat low but adequate but I recommend you get a good pair of headphones. This is the first tab I've ever purchased and I 'm considering purchasing a second one (this time a 7 inch for myself because it's more portable).

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2

Reviews.Title: Tab is Fab
Reviews.Author: Susan Worthen
Reviews.Content: I love this Galaxy tablet and having compatibility to my home pc was essential. I can share files and even use dropbox now. The one issue I had is the plug adapter that wouldnt let the tab charge from wall socket. Calling the Samsung service center is not fun and their requirement to ship the machine back was intolerable. All they needed to do was ship me a new plug. I'll have to handle that myself.

Reviews.Title: Nice Product...Upgrading Android was a pain...
Reviews.Author: R. Wong
Reviews.Content: Tablet is a nice product, but most of my nits are related to getting the thing to work seamlessly.  Upgrades are a real pain related to the relatively non intuitive operating system.  You would think a new machine would have a legible Model # and Serial #...got a jewelers loupe in your pocket?  And the software version would be easily determined, or the machine come with shortcut to upgrade...but you have to pick and choose what you "hope" is the correct version. Ice cream cones, scones or whatever.  The address bar does not retain info, and when you use tabs, if you have flaky WiFi the icons can have no info, or blank screen saved.  I will stick with a notebook for serious work and leave the tablet for play...way too quirky, flipping back and forth between cellphone like views and webpage detailed views.

Reviews.Title: Just Amazing.
Reviews.Author: Oscar
Reviews.Content: Came in the mail on time.  When I opened the package it looked brand new. It wasn't charged at all but after charging it  worked amazing.  As a matter of fact I'm writing this review from my tablet and I'm completely satisfied with my order.  I recommend it 100% and I give it five stars for an amazing product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Gadget
Reviews.Author: NJ Consumer "Just a regular Joe consumer"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome.  My family can't stop using it.  I will purchase another in the very near future.  I highly recommend it :-)

Reviews.Title: 9.5 Out of 10
Reviews.Author: Brent D.
Reviews.Content: This tablet is everything its suppose to be, except for one thing, the camera! The camera doesn't meet the quality of the tablet, was very disappointed when I first viewed the camera. But technically, this product is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung galaxy 10.1-inch

Reviews.Content: Whenever I take over for pictures for some reason the camera Freeze up I have to power it off to take pictures again. I think I'm going to send a back.

Reviews.Title: Tablet works like new
Reviews.Author: Nicolas
Reviews.Content: Refurbished set has good value for money as the item is simple, works like new and has been tested!Thanks to seller who acted to ensure delivery. Will recommend to students who need a low budget tablet who can use wifi and accesscloud storage with Internet.Good Value! Highly recommended. Samsung are the best in tablet. (screen resolution need to be better than ipad though).

Reviews.Title: Not bad for first tablet.
Reviews.Author: atman8r
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am a college freshman. It's pretty great for all the things I use it for such as Netflix and word docs. Great battery, but opt for a keyboard, this one is ridiculous. Oh, and the dual core lag that plagues it every so often, but what do you want in a 300 dollar Samsung tablet?over all great device, typed on the tab itself. Reviews.Title: Better than iPad

Reviews.Content: Screen is very responsive.  Picture is super clear.  Love the android platform.  I do wish it had a sub drive though

Reviews.Content: I like this tablet (haven't had any others to compare) but the number of system updates annoys me. Even still it fits my needs.

Reviews.Content: I like the product but I guess I was expecting more than what it is. No Adobe Flash Player, so I can't watch movies from my Amazon Prime membership. I was hoping it would be a little closer to a laptop than a smart phone. For the most part it is ok.

Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Content: Everything is great with the samsung galaxy tab 2 10.1 good shipping and its everything i thought it would be and it exceeded expectation, thanks.  Nick

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: B. Chau
Reviews.Content: I research through advertising on web & try out, I was happily own & use the equipment, so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: It's pretty much the same look a feel as the Galaxy Tab. I had the original Tab and liked it, I ended up giving that one to my Parents. It came running ICS 4.0.4 and all the new Samsung apps. I almost bought the Galaxy Note 10 but, for the price it wasn't worth the stylus. Very happy with it and I am a Samsung fan boy.

Reviews.Content: I expected much more information on the How-To website.  Only tutorial was how to download/delete apps.  Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (10.1-Inch, Wi-Fi)

Reviews.Title: THE CAMERA IS DOESN'T AUTO FOCUS!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Atiba Tucker
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA DOESN'T AUTO FOCUS!!!!! Now that I've said that I really like this product. The screen is very clear and the speakers on the side sound great. It has too many features to mention, but those that stand out for me are the remote feature and its ability to project pictures and video onto DLNA devices like smart tvs. The remote lets you pick your cable provider and enter your zip code and you can see all the channels available in your area. The screen takes almost 2 seconds to change from portrait to landscape which is a bit annoying but not a major issue for me. As I said in the begining the camera does not auto focus which makes close up pictures a little fuzzy. I downloaded a gocery app the can scan bar codes but that feature does not work because the camera cannot focus on the bar code. The processer is pretty fast and the touch screen is very responsive. if not for the camera I would have given it 5 Stars. I will probably upgrade to the Note 10.1 if it has an upgrade to Android Jellybean. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: It's Great
Reviews.Author: Rianna
Reviews.Content: My family loves the tab especially my 5 yr old. I am actually playing video games, some thing I never did. It is very relaxing and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: galaxy tab
Reviews.Author: dorazfr
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy the wifi version instead of the 3G one. Till now Im happy as I have also a smartphone and I don't miss the mobile connection. I used also one ipad and honestly both of them are nice, I personally prefer the android philosophy, that's all. I'm very happy with the galaxy tablet, wonderful videos.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: Tim F.
Reviews.Content: Great functionality.  Good battery life.  Display isn't quite what an iPad is, but still better than most others.  Only one glaring issue: no HDMI out... GAH!

Reviews.Title: Galaxy Tab2
Reviews.Author: Michael Jinks
Reviews.Content: The Galaxy Tab2 is a wonderful product.  It has about replace my laptop for most operations. Is very easy to carry and great selection of apps.

Reviews.Title: Excellent article
Reviews.Author: Joranago
Reviews.Content: very satisfied seller, item arrived as agreed and in good condition, recommended 100The tablet meets my expectations, now I have to buy the accessories to complete the connectivity. thanks

Reviews.Title: Headache Tab 2 10.1
Reviews.Author: Priceless$$
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my electronic savy husband, this is his story...."The first time I saw & had some hands-on with this Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 in the stores I thought it should be as good or better than our Samsung Galaxy 3 cellphones our family has. WRONG!!!  SOOOO WRONG!!! I soon after purchased one & started to use it on a regular bases 3 weeks in after getting cases, screen protect, accessories which is were all the problem started. Dont get me wrong it has some nice features & quality to it but the problems surpasses the nice things that it gives it would have you pulling out your hair. Example...You could be in the middle of something like surfing the web, filling out applicants, forms or sign up for something & it kicks you off the web back to the home screen where most time you have to re-enter you info, redo your research or start from scratch. It seems to happen if the tab has to load too much info from websites or takes too long to load. NOTE...I HAVE THE MAX INTERNET SPEED MONEY CAN BUY ALSO..Checked with Amazon to have something done, i just missed my return window but I can sell my $299 mint condition tab back to them for $140, not happening. Called up Samsung to have somthing done, only to be told even thou under warranty,  I wolud have pay to ship & returned back to me. Even if I do all this, they cant guarantee that they will fix or replace it if they deem it work properly, i would hope this is not a properly working device because I would have to say this Samsung product & customer service SINKS & Amazon isnt any better for selling it on there website. As much money we spend on these products & being under warranty, we shouldn't be spending anymore to have problem devices fixed or taken care of by the sellers & manufacturer. I'm very disappointed & regrets buying this product.  BUYERS BE AWARE & STAY AWAY..."

Reviews.Title: Decent product; poor customer service
Reviews.Author: pemory "pemory"
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased this device. Overall, it's pretty good, however the included web browser is very sluggish (download and use Chrome instead) and the device does not come preloaded with the Jellybean 4.1.2 OS as advertised. What I've found disappointing is that Samsung's customer service is lousy, so don't believe what you read (about how good the customer service is) in other posts. I recently tried chatting with a Samsung rep. regarding access to Jellybean 4.1.2 and even sent the rep. the link to the product listing here in Amazon (which incorrectly shows the OS as 4.1.2). I was informed by the rep. that this is an Amazon problem and has nothing to do with Samsung! So, be aware that the device has Android Jellybean 4.1.1, not 4.1.2 and that Samsung is not at all helpful in this matter.

Reviews.Title: Good basic tablet but doesn't do YouTube
Reviews.Author: nelson roman
Reviews.Content: Tablet is good for basic applications especially at this price point,  but does have a problem with video from YouTube.  The app does not load video very well and is constantly buffering.  I can play Netflix or videos from other sites but YouTube videos are terrible. It seems to be a little better if you play them from the browser but still has problems.  I've tried looking online and on Samsung support for a fix but as of yet I have found none.

Reviews.Title: Finally got my tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have the 7" at work so I was already of fan of the Samsung Galaxy.  I love the 10", i probably use it more than my laptop because it is so portable.  I love it.

Battery life is long . . . literary hours. 2. Very addictive to use. 3. Very fast and user friendly. 4. Excellent CameraCons:  1. Restricted international accessibility to some apps. 2.  Volume could be louder. Other touch pads of friends and family members seem to leave me in the dust. Sometimes way to low. :(

Reviews.Content: I like the Tablet for its convenience, lying on my bed and surfing the net,checking email and the touch screen.This my 1st Tablet and I just love it for it is quite adequate

Reviews.Title: Good product

Thank you Samsung and adobe for giving  me a 400 dollar browser.Only real bright side is that the screen is decent and battery life is impressive. Of course can't really test the resolution.

Reviews.Title: my Samsung tab 2

Reviews.Content: You cannot image how great a tablet is until you actually have one and use it!  This tablet is just like my phone and easy to use.  The seller was great and understood that I needed it directly and shipped quickly.  This large tablet is great, everyone should have one.

I thought at first I would be able to share this with my boyfriend but I find it to be a very personal thing.  It's MY TABLET! Reviews.Title: the Samsung tablet is by far the best investment I have made.
Reviews.Author: Troy Sterner
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my tablet there is nothing but this tablet can't do I like it better than me I've had the reviews are so much more indescribably better than the iPad and I take my tablet everywhere I go it's easy to plug in if you see to maneuver about the size is perfect there's nothing that I can't say about this this tablet I don't like

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet

Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet. Pleased with the performance. Fast internet speed. Great value for the money. Arrived quick. Do recommend Samsung tablets to friends.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful tablet with a great price tag too!
Reviews.Author: Marie E. Campbell
Reviews.Content: This tablet was my choice for my first tablet purchase... The Galaxy Tab 2 10.1" is very easy to use, fast and very reliable.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 Stars was because the battery doesn't last very long... it goes dead after roughly 12 hours of on and off average use.

Reviews.Title: Awsome simply Awsome
Reviews.Author: Mark Horn
Reviews.Content: I tried to get one of these about 10 months ago, but I couldn't find one so I bought the Surface RT. After a lot of frustration, I found this on Amazon and bought it. I couldn't beat the price and once I got it, I can't tell the diffrence if it was new!  I love it! The video and sound quality are amazing for such a small device and with my chromecast I can play it on my 60" TV!  The learning curve was short since I own a Nexes phone, which I can't say about the Surface RT.  Anyone want to buy a nearly new Surface RT?

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Gabriela
Reviews.Content: love it love it love it. Love the touch screen, the weight and android is the best. Great colors also

Reviews.Title: Need a lot of refinement
Reviews.Author: R. Joseph
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my mom, but she can barely use it.Even when I use it, its always doing the wrong thing.Scrolling turns into opening up links if you don't do it exactly right.Haven't yet figured out how to close several applicationsand how to get the keyboard to display when I want it.I haven't tried an ipad but I wouldn't be surprised if its much more refinedthan this.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!!
Reviews.Author: al smith
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this pad!! the apps are many and there is plenty to chose from great deal!

Reviews.Title: Will not play movies
Reviews.Author: Pete Albatross "Pete"
Reviews.Content: First thing I did with this tablet, June 15, 2013, was to rent a couple of movies from the Google Play Store to watch on a long plane flight.  They would not play, just a black screen with error message (-110). Since  Google has owned Android since 2005 and Samsung is the largest seller of Android tablets this should be easy to fix and I spent quite a bit of time with the Google support team trying to solve the problem.  Finally, August 29, 2013, they tell me they have no solution at this time and the fix will be pushed when they have one.  So if you want to watch movies on this device prepare to wait.  A minor complaint are all the pre-loaded apps that can't be removed and remain on your desktop.September 26 additional information:  Samsung made the 4.2.2 update available a couple of days ago.  This might address the issue playing movies.  Soon as I buy one I will post the results.  One problem since the update is that the tablet will not shut down.  A web search turns up a lot of Galaxy Tab 2 owners trying to figure a workaround.  Good luck on your overseas flight.

Reviews.Title: Fine laptop replacement that meets my needs
Reviews.Author: Perspicacity
Reviews.Content: My laptop died, and I needed a replacement for mostly internet browsing and app usage.The screen has crisp rendering, the touchscreen is fairly responsive, and there's lots to like about this tablet. I particularly appreciate the task manager function.My only issue is that adobe flash is not supported, and that does remove some internet browsing capacity. Other than that, and my desire for a bluetooth keyboard to avoid the annoying screen resizing issues with the touchscreen keyboard, I would recommend this tablet for generalized tablet functions such as media viewing, internet browsing, and playing games.

Reviews.Title: It's just what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Shirley A. Cannon
Reviews.Content: So far it has been pretty easy - self guiding instructions.  As of this time I haven't used is too much because I haven't put many apps on it - but I'll get there.  I'm in no hurry.  Still using my PC most of the time.

Reviews.Title: It is too slow!
Reviews.Author: Felipe
Reviews.Content: It is too slow, even with very simple applications. I dont recommend it. You should go for the Nexus or Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Just like new
Reviews.Author: 1hapiflip
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a smaller 7 in tablet and what a difference. I think it has the most recent OS but will upgrade if not There didn't appear to be any cosmetic wear. It starts up quickly and wasn't full of bloatware. I also installed a 32gb micro SD so the wife can load up on pictures, movies etc. It's only been a few days but so far so good. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Hand me down unhappiness
Reviews.Author: Linda G. Adkins
Reviews.Content: I accepted the Samsung Galaxy Tab2 from my husband who ordered  it expecting it to play the flash player videos he was missing on his IPad. Surprise, without a lot of tweaking with browsers and archives we still don't have access to flash player. Since this was not a big issue for me I happily adopted "Sam". My only criticism is the rooted Game Hub, Music Hub, Media hubs page,and the lovely S Suggest screen that are monopolizing complete pages while my preferences, apps and bookmarks are shrunk down to small thumbnails pages later. Every time I fly by I'm irritated by having to glance at unwanted advertising. At least the Kindle Fire gives you a choice if you want to pay for the privilege of no unwanted marketing!

Reviews.Title: samsung galaxy tab 2
Reviews.Author: Blanca Rosa
Reviews.Content: I love the samsung galaxy tab2 it's exactly what my husband asked for I bought it for him it's great .

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1
Reviews.Author: Alisha
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet.  It is very lightweight, easy to use, and has all the functions I need.  Now all I need is a screen protector.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for beginners.
Reviews.Author: Chelston
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tablet for a few weeks and I must say it is a great purchase. I bought this tablet from Amazon at $299 and within a few days Amazon delivered it even before the expected date of arrival.This Samsung tablet is great for anyone. The tablet is responsive and it opens apps with a breeze. Although it isn't sporting the latest android OS of today like other tablet competitors such as the Google nexus 10 it still gets the job done. The only other con that I have with the tab 2 10.1 is that a stylus is not included with the tablet which I find can come in useful when using some apps on the tablet.  This however can be purchased separately or if you want to add a few more bucks you can purchase the Galaxy Note 10.1 which also comes with some more features than the Tab 2 10.1. Other than that I would definitely recommend buying the tab 2 10.1 for anyone who is looking to emerge into the tablet world or just look for a decent tablet to buy.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Becca "Becky"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband. Although he doesn't use it much (because of the kids), it's still a great tablet for a good price on Amazon. The reason I gave it a 4 star review is because of the weight. It does hurt your wrist holding it for a while :-/

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: I've had it for  two months now. Great device. Screen is clear,  battery life long, and software very intuitive. If only I could get it to connect to one of my TV devices. I do wish it had a built in usb port.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy 2 Tab

Reviews.Title: Solid Product, but not perfect...yet
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Good tablet and easy to use.  This WILL NOT replace your laptop due to cons.  Here are the Pro's / Con'sPro's:Great ScreenEasy to Handle/NavigateSmooth flow from one screen to the nextMicroSD Card SlotGreat battery lifeCharges quicklyGood selection of preloaded widgetsThe speech to text is GREAT!Cons:No HDMI out (need to buy $30 converter)MicroSD Card is challenging to get in and out, but doable with a penWill not play my home videos in MTS or VOB formatWill not play flash videoSometimes will not sense when I press a play button, etc.  Seems to respond better with a tablet stylusHas 16GB of storage, but about half that is taken up when you get it.  Adding a MicoSD card help with thisI would recommend this tablet if you can get it for under $300 and do not mind the Con's.  Otherwise I would do some more research to see if there is something better.  But as far as having a good, solid qualilty tablet at a decent price, this may be the best there is...for now.

Reviews.Content: Really, Samsung!  The native printing works only with Samsung printers!  Where is your mobile printer offering? Also, the add-on bluetooth keyboards work wonders for usability.

The best part is that it has an external micro-sd slot which makes transferring documents a breeze.  I am still getting used to many of the differences between it and the kindle, but it seems easy enough to do.  Another thing I like is that you can sync it with multiple Google accounts so all my favorites and email addresses are transferred for me.

Apparently this is a problem this particular model has, according to androidforums I've read.On top of it; having bought my tablet through Amazon my guarantee is not valid in Venezuela.

Reviews.Title: Update: 75 days later, still no fix. DO NOT BUY THIS P-O-S ...
Reviews.Author: KGB
Reviews.Content: ... Or anything else that carries the Samsung brand.My rating would be negative stars if allowed.As the title says, this device has been screwed up for 75 days - since 9/30/13 and Samsung's firmware update. Still can't turn it off, and it still won't RUN key apps such as banking bill pay and others.Samsung and its proxies have been totally out of touch with reality on this horrible mess. They should be paying us $20 a day for holding on to what's an essentially useless product. Customer service is beyond useless. "Sorry for the inconvenience" - I've heard that far too often. Next time, I'll buy an Apple. For now our cheap Acer laptop will do. It is running just fine.*****It's now been a month since the Samsung/Android firmware update and there's still no fix from the supplier. Still have to go through the plug it in to shut it off rigamarole, and many of our must-used apps don't work. After reading reviews of the new iPad Air, i know what i will be buying instead of another Samsung.*****Update: It has now been two weeks + since we updated firmware. The device has not worked properly since that day, and is nearly non-functional.Samsung rep says there is no way to back up to previously firmware version. And Samsung/Google are working "as fast as we can because we know a lot of people are upset." No s__t! You can see how hot customers are by checking the various forums.I cannot believe that a manufacturer and its software collaborator - Google/Android - would release an update so fraught with bugs and errors.Learned my lesson: iPad will replace this POS!*****We bought this device in hopes that it would replace our old Dell desktop. Not so fast, bucko.While it's handy to use sitting on a couch, and acts much like my (now broken) Samsung Galaxy S3 phone did, the tablet apps aren't nearly as intuitive. And we have never gotten it to connect to our wireless printer (we did make the connection with my MacBook and iPhone). So, it doesn't work to print selected emails as intended.Android recently dropped a software "upgrade" on it. The device has since become almost totally non-functional. To turn it off, we need to plug in the charger and hold the power key down for about a minute. On top of that, our banking app, YouTube and a few other oft-used apps have stopped working. I deleted them from the device and attempted to download new versions, but couldn't connect. No more billpay off the tablet. Called Samsung tech support but they were unable to help.So, I have bought an inexpensive laptop computer I hope will last 3 years or so.So, anyone want to buy a used Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 wi-fi? Cheap?

Reviews.Title: Really people, Really.... an old Ibook works better.....
Reviews.Author: hdangelalex
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1" Wi-Fi reviewHello Amazon FolksThis is my review of the galaxy tab 2.  Never owning a smart phone, or anything powered by android and being my most current tech device is a apple powerbook g4 PPC running Tiger, I am very confused as to why people would wish to own this piece of work.I received this item and, for one if you are not a "Google Person" don't even buy one, you will have to set-up Google account to do anything period!  Me I am a yahoo-ian and at 60 years old just enjoy news, a book and watching a movie on my top, and of course shop on amazon :)Right out of the box this tablet fails on so many levels it is sad that so many people have embraced this device, it is more technology stupid than a early 2000's ibook.1. Will not play flash movies or games unless you download, upgrade several items and if you watch amazon movies forget it, download & install new browser, download & installed outdated, unsupported flash and hope like hell it works, and the video is equal if not less than what plays on a Ibook, WOW, what a leap in technology.2. Will not print to anything , unless you download more crap and install it and pray it works.3. Does not come with any word processor to just type a note and woosh send it away to anyone, unless you download more crud and install it, and on and on again.4. Will not print unless you download and install and and and and and and5. If it crashes, and it will, you will have to do a factory reset and lose everything you have done to make this machine actually work for you.  Seriously this is a $250.00 machine that should work for you, not you have to do minutes, hours, days of work to get it to do anything for you, this thing is a joke and not a very good one at that and I am sure that the folks at Samsung are laughing all the way to the bank on this.O.K. enough of being a hard-case, I bought this so my wife and I could read e-books, watch movies, check mail and cruise the net, and listen to our music on the road, instead of lugging old and big and chunky laptop around.  Since Amazon does not support Apple PPC machines anymore, we cannot access e-books, but can do everything else, with much more ease than this machine, we decided to give it a try, and it's screen is beautiful, it has excellent battery life, speakers are great, touch screen is great unless you have fat fingers (like me) then it is a pain (so get the pen), it is a very well built excellent unit with front and rear cameras and accepts memory cards, everything anyone would want, but yet an operating system that takes me back to the future (less flux capacitor).  So in finals, if your a Google/Android person you will luv this machine, if you enjoy downloading and installing everything you need to get going, well go for it, if you want a machine that helps you, works for you, then forget it, stick with your windows, apple, whatever puter, save your money, for this is just a smart phone that doesn't make phone calls.Thanxs.Ordering a Kindle next (I know it is droid, but hey grandpa has to try,,, Right??)

Reviews.Title: The Samsung "Find my tablet" feature is a waste of time.
Reviews.Author: Martin Sweet "Martin Sweet"
Reviews.Content: My Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 16G came with a 'Find my Tablet' feature that will locate your tablet with Google maps should you misplace your tablet.  I spent two days trying to get the feature to work, all to no avail.  The Samsung Customer Service was luke-warm at best.  It took over 12 hours for a Samsung rep to respond to my online request for assistance, and I still have not recieved a response to my follow-on question.  Luckily  I found a similiar free app online at Lookout.com. [...] I had the app up & running in 15 minutes with a successful test run on my 'lost' tablet.  Lookout.com used Google maps to show me where my tablet was located down to my street & house.  It also sounded a 'screem' on my tablet which is a great feature if I've misplaced my tablet somewhere in the house.  Otherwise, the Tab 2 is a pretty niffty device.  As of April 2013 they're all sellling in my local area for $329.00.  I bought mine at the Maxwell AFB AAFES for the same price but of course I didn't pay any tax which saved me 10%.

Reviews.Title: thought i liked it
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Gottsegen "jong"
Reviews.Content: Like others, I was attracted to the quality of the display and capabilities. However, with the new OS there is now a crappy "The Daily" app that requires a monthly fee to get any actual information but no matter how many times I tell it to stop sending messages with new updates, it still sends these updates  (actually a little update icon continuously shows up on my status bar). In addition, it no longer displays flash which eliminates a bunch of Web content. Oh, I'm not real happy with the case, and it's a but heavy. I wouldn't buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Could provide more complete instructions
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: The product is very functional and meets my needs.  I was disappointed that the instructions on how to use the product were very minimal. Also,  the web pages do not look like the ones on my laptop.  Had a hard time connecting to wi-fi at hotels, in fact I could not get it to connect at all at three hotels that I stayed at on a recent trip.

Reviews.Title: not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Spunkmeister "mrs. spunkmeister"
Reviews.Content: My expectations for this tablet may have been unrealistic, but I chose it because it supposedly had a flash player. It worked decently , though Outlook is very slow. Whenever I tried to play an Android game, I was informed that it was not compatible with Adobe flash. Only games from the Samsung game store work reliably. After two hours with tech support from Samsung, Adobe 11 was downloaded. One of my games loaded, but using it was like watching water evaporate. Words with Friends would never load. I purchased a brand specific card reader and it never recognized it. The external keyboard, full size, had two glitches in it. I'm not a happy consumer.  I am pushing the factory reset button and returning it.

Reviews.Title: WARNING! FLASH no longer supported!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne B. Kelly
Reviews.Content: As of the update to the OS, Flash is no longer supported on this tablet. That means you cannot play most games, watch movies/television, or watch ANYTHING powered by Adobe Flash player. I have talked to Samsung support, and there is NO work-around for this, no going back to a previous operating system, and no future plans for support. If all you want to do with your tablet is browse the web and read books, then you will be happy with this tablet. Otherwise, like me, you will be very angry with the false advertising. Samsung will NOT tell you about this up front, so buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Should have thought twice

Reviews.Content: Too difficult to figure out and very slow operating system.  I give it 2 stars hecause i gave it to my 78 year old mother who is just glad to have a tablet

Reviews.Title: Samsung Tab SUCKS!
Reviews.Author: T. J. Olson
Reviews.Content: Ok. I'm a Mac man and a longtime android user. So, two months ago I made the jump into tablet computers with the Samsung tab 2, 10 inch.Why not go lighter and still enjoy books, the web, and some light email. Right?WRONG! For instance, I cannot install a Kindle reader on it for my purchases here from Amazon. Why? google won't let me download a goddamned Kindle reader, THAT'S why! EVERY EVERY EVERYTIME I try and download it, I get the message from google that "you computer or network may be sending automated queries. To protect our users we can't process your request right now."Try another time? I doesn't matter - I always get the same message. Is it my network? Well, my Mac is using the same WiFi network in my living room without any problems. Is there some auto-query from my Samsung Tab? NO -ONLY GOOGLE is running!WTF???  Anyway, I give up! Samsung Tab 2 10 point whatever officially sucks - I cannot enjoy Amazon books on my tab.

Reviews.Title: Laggy as compared to other Galaxy products
Reviews.Author: C. Wang "C"
Reviews.Content: I have a Note II and it works flawlessly.  So I had high hopes for this tablet... Reviews.Title: What I wish I would have known before I bought it- shame on google
Reviews.Author: Reptizen
Reviews.Content: I own both PC and Apple products and am EXTREMELY electronic dependent and knowledgeable except that I don't feel you should have to root a tablet to make it perform basic functions. I have both an iPad 2 and a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2. I own a Galaxy S3 phone and have had other androids and iPhones. So I know each has advantages and disadvantages. I started out with the 7 in Galaxy after doing A LOT of research because I carry my iPad instead of my work laptop but as anyone with Apple knowledge knows, there are a few holes that an iPad can't fill in a PC business world. I immediately decided the 7 in was too small for my taste and replaced it after very little use for the 10.1 in version. Had I kept it longer, I might have discovered the major shortcomings and just sold it outright.I specifically bought the Samsung Tab 2 to be able to send attachments created in common programs such as word, excel, pdf, etc. The big selling point was the free versions of Polaris and other office products available through Google Play. For those who don't know, you can buy similar versions on the iPad, however, if you create a ppt for work on the iPad, you have to reformat if it will be shown on a pc once it is sent to the pc. Same with the other office like products. You also cannot "browse" and attach items such as resumes or files if you are on certain sites from Apple. So I specifically needed this on the Samsung. There are workarounds on iPad for sending attachments. On Samsung, there are no workarounds. It is just impossible. If you do a search on forums (which I should have done before) you will find that it is a common complaint and the developers do not seem inclined to address it. HUGE for a product using google (translation gmail) and yet you can't send a document via gmail from anywhere on the tablet.Still annoyed by that, I lost all copy and paste functionality. ???? Seriously??? Searched forums again. Widespread. It can be made to work intermittently by doing the hokey pokey or a seance, however, it will not last. Ever tried to copy some text so that you don't have to retype all of it....even iPad had this fixed in the very first update when there was a minor issue.Then there is all the talk about flash, java, whatever....I wasn't too worried as I primarily use the Tab for work stuff until I realized that even amazon videos, youtube content and many other standard types when you are doing a search and need a tutorial or watching the news are not supported. It also limits the amount of internet windows you can have open.It also has some function that keeps toggling between english and multi language on keyboards so that the alternative letters pop up, severely hampering my typing as you have to hit space, accept the change, then backspace to change it quite often.Add all of this to my latest inability to get a stylus (unless it is over 20 bucks and/or you root the device and download an app to make what the selling feature of the product was supposed to be) to take notes in apps designed to take notes. At my last meeting I was defaulted to my fat fingers and the note taker so that each 4 sentences took up a page. I was really looking forward to taking notes this way during meetings with clients.I also am less than thrilled with the proprietary charger plug but am not knocking off for this since Apple recently went to the thunderbolt plug on their new devices, essentially screwing everyone who owns older devices in the process.There are pros...which is why I am giving it 3 stars instead of 1 that I would give for the lack of these items. The way it opens windows in the internet is really cool despite the limit. I like the auto open in new tab. It has a great interface and Apple and other UI designers could really learn a thing or two about back buttons. And aside from it pushing out unwanted ads and spam, google play does have a lot more free apps. Plus I have always applauded the availability of an external sd card although putting stuff on it or accessing it is not easy.For playing games, watching netflix and google play, this is a decent tablet and it competes with the iPad. I have been carrying both for work when I travel, hoping that I can rely on one or the other but so far the iPad is coming closer and that is a tragic shame give the proprietary nature of its product. It seems like something backed by the inventive google team would not leave basics like these glaring holes open.

Now I'm stuck with it.My biggest gripe is how inconsistent the touch screen is . Some web pages work fine while others you just keep banging  on the screen and nothing happens. I really like browsing MSN and this thing does not work well with that page at all. If you are able to bang your finger hard enough on an article for it to respond, it takes forever to load the page.  I thought maybe it was the web page, but I have no problems using it with my iPad. I also have problems using the camera and video as it constantly freezes up and I have to reboot it to get it to work. When you are looking at this thing in the store, the Samsung salesperson will show you all the preloaded apps- don't be impressed, if you're like me you will never use most of them.Overalll I feel this tablet is a heavy, clunky, odd shaped device that is buggy with a horrible touch screen. Reviews.Title: worst purchase I've ever made
Reviews.Author: kruss
Reviews.Content: this was by far my worst purchase ever. First off, I bought this because I didn't need a full laptop, or so I thought. The sales associates at the store said it was basically like a laptop except for the optical drive. When I got home I realized it was far from a laptop.the first thing I noticed was there was no manual. It was as if they expected you to know how to work everything from the beginning. Once you get into the programs there are no help menus and icons which are fairly ambiguous are used instead of simple words.  so it takes a few times pressing different icons and hoping you don't accidentally erase somethingbefore you know what the icons are for.secondly, when typing it tries to guess words for you which are mostly always wrong, and the only way 2 change something is to press on the screen instead of using arrow keys. This makes it incredibly difficult to pinpoint the cursor over your mistakes, and typically means that you must erase more letters or words then are really necessary. I am a stickler for good grammar and competent spelling, but I have nearly given up on it all because off this ridiculous tablet.next there is the issue of simple actions that are missing from basic programs. Take Polaris Office for example, you cannot send hey file through email. By the way that quote Hey on quote was supposed to be the letter a.  again there is no help menu to show you how to send these files through email.there is no flash available for the tablet so mini sites won't work.the tablet acts more like a large cell phone than a computer.lastly I cannot tell you how many times you have to press on the screen 4 a link to work. And then sometimes if you accidentally brush the screen it send you to a site you did not intend. I have written all of this using the speak to write app. Possibly the only half redeming quality on the tablet, except that yet obviously gets plenty of words wrong. 40 instance that 40 was supposed to be 4 the word, and the word yet in the previous sentence was supposed to be it.if you're simply looking for A device to use for apps, music, and searching the internet this would be a fine choice, however if you plan to write more than 3 emails stick with your laptop.

After attempting 2 hard resets and clearing the app cache the Samsung app market still didn't work. Additionally, the tablet is not very responsive, I found myself pressing it 3 times for a Google link more than I find it bearable. Ultimately, I decided that I would rather pay $499 to get a tool like the IPAD 4 that get's the job done, then a $300 tool that is soso at best. Who knows maybe I got a defective product, although I think some people ignore the lag because it doesn't bother them. Reviews.Title: Just buy an iPad (or Kindle Fire)
Reviews.Author: K and B
Reviews.Content: For starters, I have a programming background and work for a software company. I cannot figure how this thing works, or what the designers were thinking. God help someone like my grandmother. I sat with a few coworkers, and we spent 5 minutes trying to figure how to go into the app store and download an app. Couldn't figure it out. Refused to consult a manual or Google it, so we just gave up. Fortunately this was a work owned tablet, so we didn't care. We both went back to our iPads and didn't look back. The iPad just works, whereas this tablet is work (as in a chore).(Some people reading this review haven't understood this is hyperbole. It's not that you literally can't figure out this tablet, it's that what takes 3 intuitive taps on an iPad takes 10 non-intuitive and wandering taps on this tablet).In terms of fit and finish, the button to actually turn on the screen is a tiny little invisible button around the trim ring. On an iPad, there is a big button on the front. Want to use the iPad? Press the big obvious button. Want to use the Samsung? Hold on, where's the button? Which way am I holding it? Let me check the edges. Wrong edge. Flip it upside down, then look there. Ok, found it. Now it's on.This tablet has widgets. You can move stuff around. It shows the weather on the home screen! Cool, except: This kills battery life. It takes time to organize all this fluff. Once organized, no one else can find anything on your tablet. With an iPad, everything is there. No fluff. Want the weather, click the weather app. No need to install a weather widget. Hand the iPad to someone, they immediately know how to use it.Just buy an iPad. You can get a like-new refurbished iPad for a few bucks more. Buying this instead would be like buying a Ford when you could have had a Mercedes for almost the same price. Not that this tablet is that bad, it's just that you can get much better for almost the same money.If you need a cheap tablet, get a Kindle Fire. Cheaper and should be just as good.

Reviews.Title: Not a good replacement if you need intermediate spreadsheets (like excel)
Reviews.Author: A Savvy Shopper
Reviews.Content: I'm going on a trip and wasn't looking forward to lugging my 5 lbs laptop with me.  For one day, I'll need excel to process some work spreadsheets and reports while I'm on vacation.  So I actually bought the tablet to test it out.It works a lot like my samsung galaxy nexus phone, which I love.  the speed, graphics, netflix, angry birds, chrome surfing on the internet--all beautiful.  i love that i can speak at the tablet, and it will take my words and do a search on it. that's something i often wish my laptop would catch on to.  just a matter of time, right?as for spreadsheets, there is an application called Polaris office. with much effort, i figured out how to paste raw data from an internet page (text and numbers) to polaris spreadsheets.  i saw that a bluetooth keyboard and mouse might be helpful for moving numbers/data around.  however, without the official microsoft excel software i am used to, there a few functions that i just couldn't get to work.  one was "text to columns" data parsing, which i needed to paste the data i got off the internet onto a spreadsheet, with numbers falling into different columns.  and i also could not convert data, once in the spreadsheet, into pivot tables (a sort of database function).  i should have known, as this is a more advanced excel function.  and i'm sure microsoft is not going to be doing any favors for android/google.if you're contemplating using the tablet for intermediate excel or spreadsheets, this is not a good laptop replacement . . . yet.i hope this helps someone else wondering a similar question.  otherwise, i still gave the tablet 4 stars.  it is quite impressive and much faster than my kindle fire (does not get stuck one bit).  you can even expand the memory with a micro sdhc card--and those are getting pretty cheap and fast now.  for me, there didn't seem to be a ton of bloatware on the tablet, and if there was, i could remove things very easily using their operating system (drag to trash).  my only disappointment for the fun software is not being able to find a new yorker magazine application for samsung tablets yet.  on my kindle fire, it makes the new yorker a thousand times better to read. so that would have knocked my kindle fire out of usage.

Reviews.Title: Bad screen! It flickers and flashes... not even a week old...I'm returning it
Reviews.Author: AnnN
Reviews.Content: Stay away!I just bought this last week and haven't even used it every day.  This week the screen suddenly started flickering and flashing bright colors... yellow and pink. Every time I touched the screen or tried to scroll it would just go crazy flashing so badly I had to close my eyes.  I'm thinking anyone prone to seizures should beware!  I couldn't get it to stop.  Very disappointing!  It's going back tomorrow.  :(I have to say that even before this screen problem, I was not all that impressed with this tablet.  It's my first so I have nothing to compare it to, but I somehow expected more.  It's not overly fast and scrolling isn't all that smooth.  It's kind of jumpy when you're trying to zoom in or out.  Seems like it overcompensates a lot.  It also seemed to suddenly jump to another page or app when I don't think I even touched on them, but I suppose maybe I accidentally touched a spot on the edge of the screen or something and didn't realize it?I'd have to say that I found this tablet a generally frustrating experience.Update 12/8/12:I purchased an Asus transformer tf300t and so far it has been amazing.  Definitely outperforms the Tab 2.  It is very fast and scrolling and zooming are very smooth.  So far no problems.Another update 8/04/13:  I just realized I never came back to update this with my end result.  I ended up returning the problematic Asus also and bought an ipad 2.  My son is an Apple guy but I kept refusing to listen to him when he kept telling me to just buy an ipad or to at least go to a store and play with a floor model and see the difference. Well i finally did.... and much as I hated to admit it HE WAS RIGHT.  Ok, I said it.  Ugh.  The best way to explain it is It simply WORKS.  Smooth as can be and a delight to use. The quality is amazing.  I also love the shape of it.  It's not as narrow as the other pads making it much nicer to view online content.  So there you have it.  In the end, my Tab review ends up being a recommendation to just get an ipad. :0

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the resolution
Reviews.Author: G. Abhaya "Panaromic"
Reviews.Content: I settled on this tablet after reading tons of online product reviews. Part of my decision to buying this tablet is based on what I read in those online reviews and the other part is because of the fact that I already have all my online contents in Google friendly platforms and this tablet being Android OS I can keep all my contents synced up across all my devices. I could without a sweat (within 2 minutes after I unpacked the product) get this device to sync up with my other device contents - awesome. Then downloaded couple of my apps, visited a few of my favorite websites, played a few videos and movies from Netflix and other sites. That is when I noticed how poor the resolution is on this tab, especially the text during the film credits practically not readable. I am comparing the resolution of the same film credits on my 1440x800 Mac screen, Samsung 1280x800 - it is night and day. For discerning eyes, you could easily notice the poor video quality also. I must say the text of eBooks have good resolution though.Having used iPad, lack of zooming, pinching, gestures etc, makes this tab seem less user-friendly and non-responsive. I feel the touch screen is less responsive sometimes, I need to touch harder to launch apps or sometimes I need to go back screen and come back to the current screen to launch an app - weird - I am thinking the screen may be less sensitive to the finger pressure.  Not very many apps available for this tab to be useful beyond basic functionality.I haven't tested the SD card reader etc. so can't say anything about that feature yet. Some of the reviews I have read, expandable storage capacity of this device via SD cards as the positive feature of this Tab over iPad; so I haven't tested the salient feature of this tab yet. I paid less than $290 for 16GB of storage which is a lot less for a comparable iPad device. In this case, I believe I got what I paid for; i.e. the price is right for this quality.
