Reviews.Title: The Jury is still out...Consider this a WIP
Reviews.Author: Baldwin the Bland
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Sears in January 2013, two days before the big snowstorm hit the East Coast of the USA. (Hey, it was $50 cheaper there than at Best [oxymoron alert] Buy, and I didn't have somebody trying to stuff an overpriced and probably useless "Extended Warranty" up my left nostril, either. Plus I had the tablet in hand for a snowed-in weekend. Which may not have been the case if I'd bought it here.)I figured I'd write something up for myself and for others in my situation, a/k/a spiritual descendents of Ned Ludd. So my comments probably don't apply to the propeller heads out there, as much as I and everyone else rely on them these days. You guys (and girls) doubtless have a far better grasp of the ins and outs of this device than I ever shall, but for all that I can't see that (in this case) my ignorance necessarily invalidates my thoughts.Or, to put it bluntly, "user experience" is a subjective and NOT an objective thing. Got it? Some of my thoughts may be unfair, in that Samsung probably has no control over some of what follows, but so what? I bought the tablet hoping do certain things. If I can't get them to do those things, or at any rate not easily, I'm a less than happy user. And I'm gonna honk like an angry Canada Goose interrupted mid-turd drop at your favorite local pond, lake or river. (Doubtless some auditors of this review will think that said metaphor applies to this review as a whole, but such is life.) Contra that, this admitted ignorance is also why I'm marking this review as a "Work in Process." If I figure out how do some of things I'm less than thrilled about, I'll come back and say so. Not sure if I'll be able to edit the rating, but I'll cross that bridge when and if I come to it.Anyway, enough bloviating.PLUSES:+ It is not Apple. I've had it with Kupertino Krap, and will never again drink any Kupertino Kool-Aid.+ The YouTube screen-tap issue cited by Xin Ning in their review seems to have gone away, at least for me. (The artist selection screen looks different, though, so possibly they were talking about going in via a channel and not a plain old search? Dunno, since I've never done that and am not certain how to.)+ Very sharp looking screen.+ The camera and video features seems above average to excellent from where I'm sitting. Not sure what is expected in that department, but I'm more than happy with what I've got+ The integration with Gmail and Google Drive. Much easier than I expected.+ Kindle and Overdrive - I've read library e-books via both. Both have worked flawlessly thus far.+ Did I mention it is NOT Apple?MINUSES:- The Flash thing, Part I: Why exactly should I install something on the device that the Adobe website itself says:****Below is a list of device and OS combinations that are certified for running Adobe Flash Player. Installing Flash Player on an uncertified device may result in unexpected behavior and can potentially destabilize your device.Please note: Flash Player will not be certified for any device OS beyond Android 4.0.x.****Great. Frickin' great. So I put something on the device that can potentially wreck it, and also invalidate whatever warranty might otherwise be in place. And that's if I can figure out which iteration of Flash I'm supposed to be installing. This is like one of the Kupertino Kool-Aid drinkers claiming that their [overpriced and equipped with training wheels whatever] is just wonderful NOW that they've done a Jailbreak on it.- The Flash thing, Part II: I realize Amazon is in this business to make money. I get that. I also get that the main reason I signed up for Amazon Prime had nothing to do with the video service. It is still a flaming hemorrhoid that there's no app, free or paid, that will run on anything anything but an I-Pad or a Kindle. In sum: Very, very lame, Mr. B. And you'll not be getting any rentals or purchases at $2.99 a pop from me, either. At least at present.- The Flash thing, Part III: (OCD a bit? Well, maybe.) I tried jinkying around with various browsers: FF, Chrome, and Samsung's default, and none of them would run Amazon's streaming service. I've not yet tried the MX Player or Dolphin, so possibly one of them will work. My point here being is not that I might or might not get it to work ultimately, but that I'm irritated that I have to jump through all these hoops in the HOPE I'll get it to run. Seems like way too much work to finally get to watch Operation: Nazi Zombie or some other uplifting fare in bed at night.- The sound - The speakers sound tinny to my ears. A bit better with headphones, but the problem with them is that they don't seem loud enough. (Whether or not that is the result of a misspent youth of one too many Judas Priest concerts, well, I'll leave that as an open question.) Even via the auxiliary jack in my car, with the bass all the way up and the treble reduced I can't say I'm thrilled. Though it gives the best sound I've yet gotten from the Tab 2.- Samsung's App Store - The games section is a HUGE bait & switch operation. "Free" typically means free for two levels and then you either have to buy something, join a dating service (WTF is THAT about?) or apply for a credit card. Samsung is doubtless relying on outside vendors here, but since it is at their site I consider this a completely fair criticism. They could and should do a better job policing what is, after all, their own playpen.JURY STILL OUT? Samsung's App Store - Other than the games, that is. I've d/l'd a few apps, some I like, some I'm annoyed with or about. Or have already deleted.? Other App Stores - I d/l'd a supposedly free wallpaper from Amazon's Android App store last week. It looked like it downloaded, claimed it downloaded, but wound up nowhere I could see on the device. Since I haven't gotten buried with ads for Russian mail order brides (yet), I'm assuming this was either a failed download or something otherwise benign. At least I hope so.? Device Documentation - I know I need to do a bit more reading in this area, but I'm thinking this device is still not all that inuitive to use? Device Layout - If I had nickel for every time I've shut off the screen while meaning to turn adjust the volume, well, I'd probably have about $5.00. Maybe I'm the only fool on the planet who does such a thing on a regular basis, and maybe I'll get used to it. Still a bit too early for me to say.TENTATIVE CONCLUSIONDevice is okay. Nice, but no "wow" factor at all. It does some things well to very well, but it also has its share of quirks and liabilities. I'm certainly not going to be shifting back to Kupertino Kool-Aid (shudders). But am I going to be wondering if I overpaid for this device compared to some other Android OS tablets out there? Oh boy, you betcha.

Reviews.Content: I returned the tablet a week after I began to use it.  Some program "keys" are along frame of tablet.  Had to be careful as to where tablet was held as screen would change if accidently touching one of theses "keys".  Getting to and from different apps and windows too convoluted..  Would receive messages advising user to close window before allowed to proceed to different app or windows -- what windows?  Had no other windows open.  This tablet not user friendly.

Reviews.Author: DJG
Reviews.Content: I will need my son's assistance in using this. Right now I don't have Wi-FI at home which I know i need.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth J Ankenbauer
Reviews.Content: While the product might work, there is no documentation or help for the device except for a 6 tiny page getting started booklet that tells you where the on/off switch and volume control is and how to connect to the internet.  Beyond that, your on your own.  I cannot figure out how to use anything on the device.  I use a laptop computer daily, but this thing does not work anything like a computer and is not at all intuitive.  It is just a very expensive paperweight, sorry I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Will not connect to router.
Reviews.Author: F. Tucker "Secret"
Reviews.Content: Spent six hours trying to get it to connect to our router. Finally called Samsung. The man I spoke with said the device was working correctly. I could see my routers name on the device. It keep reading connecting, or scanning , so my router was the problem. I told him my Samsung smartphone, and our I pad were connected to the router and they work fine. He insisted that I needed to contact the router company.Needless to say, I returned the tablet, to the store I purchased it from the next day. I spent a few more dollars to purchase another I pad. It had no problem connecting to our router. I am writing this review on the new Apple I pad.

Reviews.Title: Not Ready For Prime Time
Reviews.Author: Sparkles41
Reviews.Content: I bought and returned this after a week of struggling to use it.  I found it not to be intuitive to operate/navigate, couldn't find decent apps, couldn't see any real support system nor instructions and never figured out how to remove bloatware.  You get what you pay for.  There's a reason the iPad is the gold standard.  Traded it in for an iPad and within hours felt like I had joined the 21st century.  Samsung is a legend in its own mind.  In reality, it is a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Samsung does not honor warranties
Reviews.Author: jBentrim
Reviews.Content: Actually the product is pretty nice.  But I bought a toner from Samsung that when installed in two different printers had a dark streak down the side of the paper. Tried and tried to get them to replace and they will not. If they don't take care of a simple problem, I would hate to see what they do on a more complicated one. If I'd know they were dishonest and did not honor warranties I would have never purchased this product.

Reviews.Content: I am thinking of buying this product I have an archos 705 for my music and it stinks never buy archos again how does this tablet sound after I would rip my cd's to it and play it on my home stereo's does it sound great or does it lack volume if anybody can give me feed back on this that would be great thanks.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Average Perfomance, Horrible Speakers, iPad still better
Reviews.Author: Angel_Pen "angel_rising"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet specifically because of the front speakers which turned out to be absolutely mediocre and metallic sounding. Not what I was expecting at this price range at all. The tablet also has poor viewing angles. The screen resolution is below average, not a bid deal but don't expect much.The color balance is slightly off albeit not as bad as the hideous color distortion exhibited by the Google Nexus 7 tablet which has by far the worst LCD calibration on the market.Conclusion: I have tested almost every tablet on the market and the iPad has the best sound reproduction. Since you can buy a used old generation iPad for the same price as a new Galaxy Tab 2, there is no real reason to buy the later unless you love the Android environment (which sort of sucks) or you are a developer or there is a certain app that is not available at the Apple store.Note: Ignore the 5 star reviews, they are all fake. Instead concentrate on the 3 stars or less for a more accurate experience.

Reviews.Content: Not worth the price,  sorry I received it tot x-mas! Can't. Watch movies,  only apps are those from samsung and google play. I WOULD NOT RECCOMEND THIS TO MY WORST ENEMY!

Reviews.Title: $91 to replace battery
Reviews.Author: newjourney2006 "newjourney2006"
Reviews.Content: I called Samsung about battery replacement. To replace battery you must mail in the tablet for repair. The cost $66+25=$91.

Reviews.Title: No USB ports.  No pointer on screen.  Cannot download Adobe Flash on Android.  Sync has problems all the The list goes on and on
Reviews.Author: englishlady
Reviews.Content: No USB ports.  No pointer on screen.  Cannot download Adobe Flash Player on Android.  I tried!  Sync has constant problems.  Says it will be ok shortly....but shortly never comes.  I wish I had never bought this tablet.  No place to go for help that is helpful.  Samsung webpage is too crowded with other products.  Nothing helpful for this tablet.  I would return it for a refund, but I live in South America, so I guess I am stuck.  It was my Xmas present to myself.  So much for a Merry Xmas!
